y8lz_6KWGOQ9jcTyIdwTLQ.review_text: Quite a bit nicer than the average sports bar. Even the ladies like it.

cafwMe1yHtWi-2PE0C9KWA.review_text: Trivia nights are fabulous and the staff is awesome. Fun chill nights are spent here. We live close and make it here at one or two times a week and it's always pleasant.

emIVSls-1hbkPIf4QeEDkg.review_text: I love this bar. It has that certain je ne sais quoi you look for in a local bar. There's a great trivia night on Tuesdays. It's perfect spot to watch a game. The bar staff is fun and entertaining. I have been there many times when the bartender makes a round of shots for the whole bar. The burgers are awesome, but don't always expect the kitchen to be open.

tgUvk_rJXFr24q-X7I1U2A.review_text: This is an Arizona State University football viewing bar - and I love it is packed with my fellow Devil fans.  The bar was packed, and the bartenders are very limited on time and resources.  The bartenders were a lil' snappy because they are so busy...so maybe they should have more there...just a thought?  I didn't eat anything there, but the food sounded great and the people around me said it was good.  Though the service was a little bit of a turn-off, I will go there again for the benefit of the doubt.

iuysnFLpWUzfZtrphPOqCQ.review_text: My new company recently celebrated its launch party at The Boardroom, and we recommend it wholeheartedly.  My first experience with The Boardroom was a random Friday night for happy hour a few months ago.  The place has a cool, surfer theme, which was appropriate for watching "Point Break" on the bar's TVs. That was not Casey's choice of movie (the manager who was tending bar that night) but he was joking along with us, chatting with everyone.   He even recommended a great new gin to freshen up my tonic.  When we finally contacted him about the possibility of having our launch party there, he was nothing but accommodating.  It's hard to find a place for 30-40 people for a weekday happy hour without a crazy price tag or an attitude.  Casey was as happy to have us there as we were to find such great place.  And in all our planning, Casey was quick to call back, professional with a sense of humor.  Perfect.  The event went amazingly well.  Ben was the fantastic bartender taking care of us that night.  He was so nice, and made great drinks.  He and Casey even made a signature cocktail for us for the party.  We also were able to plug our iPod into the sound system and enjoy a personal playlist.  What really sealed it for me is that the next morning, Casey gave a quick call to see how the event went.  That was unnecessary and completely appreciated.  So if you are looking for an event space for 20 - 60 people, definitely give Casey a call.  Even the regulars at the bar are super-friendly and nice.  The food here is really good, as well - can't beat bacon-wrapped tater tots.  It's a very clean place with a warm vibe.  (And no, there is no broken sink, like in the photos - it's a perfectly nice bathroom!)   When you find yourself in North Beach, thirsty or hungry and in need of a friendly face, head to The Boardroom.

wJgtf18VKKZq9A6ZQUybQw.review_text: My alumni group scheduled a game viewing here which is probably the only reason I would have stumbled upon this place. It's not a huge bar, but I didn't feel claustrophobic when it started getting pretty packed after the game started. I scored some seats up front by the window and when it wasn't too busy, the service was great. I had an order of the crispy pork buns (good+) and the bacon wrapped tater tots (over-hyped and only okay), as well as my fair share of drinks. My main complaint is that well into the evening, there was a TON of people in the bar and only one bartender, so it took forever to get a drink after he noticed you at the huge bar. This wouldn't stop me from returning, but I hope they plan for better coverage when they have events like that.

rMsckQ35fAdzgYZQr7VPmw.review_text: I've been here twice and it's great. I've been looking for a good local bar that doesn't seem like a run-down frat house for awhile now. I was drinking there all day one Saturday and of course, that got out of hand quickly, but it's a great place to sit at the bar, meet a few people, and have some really great apps.   On Trivia night it was pretty serious, and very packed. I swear the team behind me was cheating and took my team's answers... but then again I would too if I heard a team shout out every answer we picked for everyone to hear. Thanks Brett and Tom. We could've taken the place by STORM!

kyG14FyCWmVW3Uefs_GE_Q.review_text: The bartenders are wonderful. The drinks well made. The trivia night matredee is the best in town. The $2 tacos and the fish tacos are tasty. The $2 tiger beers are nice on those lean evenings. Pub quiz is great, even if the movie/music round makes me feel stupid every time.  If you're not going here on tuesday night you are either ill informed or hate america.  Or yourself.  Maybe both.

5e15KDvcXw6J6b5E4a3eQA.review_text: FINALLY!!! MY ASU BAR!!  Somewhere in the city you'll find it. You might stumble upon it, it might take you years, but you will, and mark my words, you WILL find your sports team's bar.  For me, I've been searching since June, not too bad but it felt like eternity.  And truth be told, another ASU alum told me about this infamous ASU bar, and the ONLY one in the city.  I'm a little cautious to believe this so I still have my eyes open for another one.  The bar reminds me of ASU a lot.  Crowded, filled with beautiful people, VERY drunk beautiful people, in a dirty location.  I was so pleased to be around all the Sparky loving hotties I could care less about the dingy bar.   I don't know about the other days, but I'll be there on Saturdays, cheering on my failing team with hope in my heart and a Bud light in my hand.

tDWr9QfVH1-phUEjCGYglA.review_text: The boardroom was okay for a birthday party. It was a fairly small venue. We luckily got a booth but the speakers were way to loud and a bit dark changing the mood of a well wanted upbeat crowd. Trivia night was a ton of fun though. The place was a no frills bar but the food for Taco Tuesdays was really good. I would go again if I wasn't right by the speakers and maybe had a seat at the bar.

Dhic2o4tLR-pEDZyPiHB1A.review_text: Love these Guys! Definitely a great place to go for a beer and watch a game with some great bar food.

bpgbVPJcG-wQ4cNBcPPIxw.review_text: Looking for a dive bar in the city that locals frequent and the tourist don't wander into? Then The Boardroom is your place to go!  This place is a dive, but you can get bacon wrapped tater tots, WHAT?  BACON on potato action, hell yea! They were good, not mind blowing but good, its bacon how can you go wrong.  Couple of TVs on the wall to catch some games, nice seating area, looks like it could get packed, was there on a Sunday afternoon and it was 50% full.  Blue Moon on tap and that's what I drank.  Restrooms are a hot mess, do go, HOLD IT!  Took some pics, shared a laugh or two, so good times happened in this place.

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: I love the feeling that I get when I walk into my local, favorite bar. I haven't gotten this feeling since my hayday in Chico until I met up with some new and old friends at The Boardroom.  In search of a bar playing the OSU game on a Thursday night, my friend called the bar in the afternoon. He was lucky enough to get the owner, Keith, who assured him he would play his game that evening. Sure enough, a man of his word, Keith had it on the big screen and we bellied up to a tall table surrounded by bar stools.   We were greeted like we had been coming to The Boardroom for years. The guest bartenders, which on Thursday nights take cash tips for different charities, were really friendly and fast. And, by the end of the night we had met the usual staff, and we were chatting it up.  I now know about the trivia night and the fish tacos, so you may see me swaying about on my barstool on Tuesday's (taco in one hand, beer in the other). Thanks for the hospitality! We all walked away saying what a great new place to make our favorite neighborhood bar.

aON_SCN0U9G9OiHPye6pCw.review_text: Went there for the Niner's game on a Sunday. Decent crowd, it was thanksgiving weekend so the crowd was probably lighter than usual but the $4 bud lights and the service turned me off.  As there were only like 20 people in the bar I didn't expect to have to stand behind the bar for a couple minutes and wait for a round of beers. They do have beer + shot specials so that is a plus however overall the bar was nothing special. Good spot to watch the games and get your Sunday buzz on.

_PYbCltP0Re0s5DDxfOZ-g.review_text: Definitely a hidden find in North Beach.  Tucked away on the corner of Powell and Beach Blanket Babylon St.  A good place to grab a quick pint while chatting with some friendly locals!

Zcs4PX2495FeHNAyidlX4g.review_text: Sweet Jesus what a night. My buddy and I had just got into San Francisco, it was Halloween Saturday and we'd finished off a 12-pack in our hostel whilst trying half-heartedly to decide what to do. We'd just come off five nights in Vegas so we were a little worse for wear, and weren't sure if we had it in us to go out. I consulted Yelp anyway, memorised the directions to the Boardroom and away we went.  Since we're idiot Australians, we didn't have costumes for Saturday night as we were going to buy them the next day for a party we were going to. So we were essentially the only two people in the place not dressed up. But it didn't matter; bartenders Bruce (Magnum PI) and Ben (Zach Galifianakis) gave us some sage advice on Halloween culture and then plied us with booze. All fucking night.  At some point, one of the guys decided the bar needed to hear the soundtrack from The Hangover, which I just so happened to have on my iPhone. Minutes later, my iPhone was responsible for music for the next hour and a half, even after the soundtrack ran its course. There I found myself, rapping in the back of the bar with a random local girl and thinking "wow, they're playing some kick-ass songs in here!" Duh.   I'd also like to use this review to apologise to the off-duty bartender who I kept buying Jameson shots and PBR for, even though he was wasted. I'm sorry man. I know you didn't need them, God knows I didn't either, and one of us had to drink them.

2xMannyRA_gPFOMF1JKA8Q.review_text: The Boardroom recently hosted the launch party for my small business. Now, since we're just starting out, we don't have money to just throw around. No matter, The Boardroom let us have it there...for free! No problem. Buy food from us, or bring in your own - no problem. Decorate the place with balloons and tablecloths and napkins (we're girls, obviously) - no problem. Play your own music (for all they know it could've been a Taylor Swift nightmare. It wasn't) - no problem. Buy back the champagne we over-ordered - no problem. Just the nicest, most accommodating bunch of guys. Truly.

0sSWKnF5mc2YK5_jfy98rw.review_text: We held our fantasy football draft here.  We had a great time.  Martin, the manager, was awesome.  He took care of us and made us feel like we were regulars.   There seem to be plenty of drink specials that make this place a very good value as well.  The Boardroom is a place that any of us would definitely go back to for a game or drinks.  There's a pay parking lot right next door and the place is a block off Columbus, which is perfect for those that appreciate a low key feel.  The place had 4 flatscreens (sports), music, decent food (nachos were good), and wifi (although we couldn't get the Macs to work with it).

pbtoL7wBtv-aER27zewozQ.review_text: We ended up at this busy little dive on a Sunday morning for Brunch. They were playing college football and a mix of random music genres, & the crowd was super friendly and unpretentious.  The food? Surprisingly good. I had a bellini cocktail,  he had coffee, & we were both satisfied. Awesome bacon, yummy breakfast burritto, fresh quality fruit. This isn't a place we'd drive out of the way for, but we had reasonably priced, fill-you-up food with no wait.

mFsgzbMr11tQvm58yfuE4w.review_text: So I went here with my room mates for a burger and a beer and was really disappointed.  The burger was small and poorly prepared.  My fries were amazingly both burnt and cold.  For $10 I expect more than I got, even in North Beach.  Even though the place was not busy it still took an excessive amount of time to get our food.  The one upside is the bar tenders were cool.    2 stars - food 1 star - price 3 stars - service 3 stars - atmosphere  Bottom line, if you want to wait a long time for an overpriced poorly made burger, this is the spot.  Otherwise go elsewhere.

S_GMOPwx_QzO6MQVh_UQWw.review_text: Boardroom is a great laidback bar that provides the perfect middle-of-the-week entertainment. It is pretty much guaranteed that you will find me here on a Tuesday night for tacos and trivia. The trivia is great...a smattering of current events, some movies, random music, and photos. Not too hard or too easy. But the real surprise for me was the tacos. Boardroom has great fish tacos. Seriously. And $2 on Tuesday? Yes, please.

3V2hlA4qQJpn6CWF-6SUqw.review_text: Small and quaint but perfectly efficient...the Steve Nash of sports bars.

Ln0Q0eO_GQ8A8-zu8d_7Pw.review_text: So, after years and years of being a complete ignorant schmuck, the boardroom has made me progressively smarter in the last two weeks. Well maybe just a little smarter. They host tequila taco trivia tuesdays (great use of alliteration, huh?), which is, you guesed it - tequila, tacos and trivia on a tuesday night. The prizes for the winning team is a $30 tab and the best team name gets a bottle of champagne. There's nothing like the lure of free booze to bring out the competitiveness in all of us. Hint: the most vulgar team names consisting of four letter terms for female genitalia coupled with some kind of political euphemism usually win. So most nights will start with you arguing with that one really trashed teamate you just met at the bar who claims that JFK was the youngest president ever in American History. Then the other teamates are like "no you numbnut, it's Teddy Roosevelt". Somehow that one drunken friend always manages to convince everyone else he's right. After feeling raped of their dignity at the end of the night the sore losers go home empty handed and with a little indigestion from the awesomely incredible, yet greasy tacos, only to brush up on a little CNN and start the cycle all over again for the following tuesday.

0YSBWd176lBnRUHDmwgQcg.review_text: if you are in the hood and looking for nice bartenders and inexpensive drinks this is a good choice. $2 tecate! im in!

pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg.review_text: "Were famous for our Bacon Tater Tots!" read their window. Good enough to reel me and my friends in as we drove by. Boardroom was a solid stop for a mini pub crawl. Small and intimate enough to get a drink, touristy enough to not be a dive, enough locals for street cred in the touristy North Beach area, and recession buster happy hour prices to make a solid neighborhood joint. You could probably overrun this joint if you had a big enough group. Came on a Monday night where the .50 cent chicken wings was the eat of choice and $4 dollar taps were the drink of choice. A local enough tap to get a taste of SF beers. My White Lightning was brewed in the Bayview dist. It was then replaced by a Watermelon wheat brewed by 21st Amendment out in the SOMA. Both washed down the pub grub nicely. * BAC-O-TOTS -12 for $8. Perfectly crispy. They were probably Ore-Ida tots but damm these were good. Made great fat snacks.  (yelp.com/biz_photos/mi8A…) - Their unique brunch meny maybe worth trying if you get tired of waiting at Mama's up the block.     - Their Tuesday Trivia night w/ tacos and Tecates for $2 would be welcome  in my neighborhood.

VCdP3RY871UmrlVZVI4dEA.review_text: Great bar type food and bartenders in a locals spot. Everything on the weekend brunch menu is good (in general, not just for a bar) and don't forget the Bloody Mary and bac-o-tots for dessert! My favorite trivia spot, sports bar and hangout bar.

KRXDCACSspW1lmSKyrw9vQ.review_text: Love this place--great corner bar to go to any day of the week 1.  Strong drinks -- great prices -- $2 Olympias at times too 2. Nice bartenders 3. Good food -- Really cheap too! 4. Low key most of the time (on occasion -especially on trivia night it gets a little packed and it is a little rowdy in there-- its usually not too bad though) Overall, never a bad choice when looking for somewhere to go!

H5zNEMUfGMRE6O51hHoirw.review_text: A few weeks ago, a couple of my college friends from Ohio were in town, and the weekend of their stay just happened to coincide with the OSU-Texas game.  I got the tip that Zeke's is where most Buckeye fans go, but we got there late and there was a line.  We took a cab to North Beach to look around for a place to watch the game, and by some miracle we stumbled upon Woody Zips.   They didn't have much of a food menu yet, but sweet potato fries were all we needed to see.  They were awesome.   Overall, the place seems to have a great atmosphere, and is a very cool addition to the neighborhood.

SpXN9tm9oYJ1OkUszIVTlA.review_text: Yelp 100 and bacon tater tots...had slighly higher expectations of this small, non-descript bar. Definitely divey, and a neighborhood bar for sure. Prices are ok, food selection is limited, not sure on cleanliness...when the guy from the kitchen brought out our nachos, his towel was definitely sitting in it. Small nachos for $7 is definitely a small plate of nachos...prices not great, but not terrible. Bartender was playing music off of his ipod/iphone in-between football games and friendly enough. Nothing great, but not a bad place if you just to have a beer with friends and watch a game.

woW3EEoyj5M42Z7yXLhNLg.review_text: My dear friend "Pants Free" Patton wrote me a little ditty a while back- allow me to share:  (sung to that really annoying Sound of Music tune, only awesomer)  Raindrops on roses and beerpong with blokes, Boys who ride motorbikes, and like to Superpoke Gchats, and Yelping, and kickball outings These are a few of Anna's favorite things!  Patton was totally bang-on, but she did neglect to mention one of my most revered activities: trivia! Turns out there's a lot of useless knowledge in this head of mine, amidst all the air.  A group of my girls and I went to the Boardroom to try our luck at the pub quiz, and indulge in two dollar tacos. Since I'm fiscally irresponsible, I eschewed the deal and went for the significantly pricier calamari and quesadilla, and consequently had to undo my top button of my pants when I was done stuffing my face. Thanks for covering that up, sweater!  My friends and I turned out a solid performance, and even though we didn't win the whole thing, we were victorious in the challenge for best team name- no one came close to "That Prickmadam's Titular Area Is A Real Cockchafer, But I'd Pay $50 To Do A Dickey Grind In Her Cooter." (The Prickmadams, for short.) Yup, the classiest broads in the place got a free bottle of dumpy champagne, which we subsequently chugged...out of the bottle.  Minus 1 star since I went to preschool with one of the bartenders there, and he pushed me down the stairs when we were two. Additional star will be added when he buys me a shot to make up for it. :)

c4bNOJ5XnKKoHJoQE4zrcQ.review_text: Love love love this place! Trivia is fun but get there early for a seat! Drinks are great and well priced. Don't expect fancy drinks + martini's, this is my favorite local dive!

Zk5eRWLobrqJQFGY64y5sg.review_text: I stayed across the street from the Boardroom where the people I stayed with were regulars. They took me (at 9am) and had fun! When I came back to SF, I didn't stay with those friends but I made damn sure to go back to the Boardroom. It was a rainy monday night and there was hardly anyone there but the bartender loved us, chatted us up, and took pictures for us. He even thought of fun pictures for us to take. haha! I will, without a doubt, go back.

ts7thBPcvNi2dLwSgF-nUQ.review_text: Home of the bacon wrapped tater- tots. How can you go wrong? You can't if you order them with a pint of beer. Great place and easy atmosphere.

70WzR6h6CrGVx5Oc6jpsfw.review_text: Semi dive-like bar with enough room to fit about 50 people. Yes, small!  There were a lot of late 20-somethings here in a Thursday as there wasn't much else around here. There were some tater tots floating around that look amazing, but we did not get any food.  Beer was cheap enough but we were only here for one, so that's about all I can say.

AG3qumWJW32yJtizz7-saQ.review_text: This bar is a great neighborhood spot.  I always have a good time - whether it is for weekly Tuesday Trivia, Thursday night football, college football Saturdays...or just to pop in for a few drinks.  The beer+shot specials are always a solid choice!  Tuesday Tacos are delicious - not greasy, more gourmet.  Only complaint - sometimes when they are hosting a college team's fan base, it feels as though the bar is over capacity and impossible to even get a drink or move (I'm used to crowded rowdy bars, so this isn't just a dumb girl complaining about being squished and sweaty)...Usually find a hideout in the back dart room when this happens so it's all good!

Cj5weEcAZKlBb4-4le2Xng.review_text: Decent for a neighborhood dive. They accept credit cards which is also a plus.

ZObHXI05ILUFpDo_m7DjzQ.review_text: Back on the Drink hunt trail!   A quick dash up the hill to the next bar, The boardroom. We quickly found the clue above the bar. Nice  spot too. I'm really glad we went along on this drink hunt. Great way to discover new haunts.    A round of drinks and a couple of baskets of tatertots later, (delicious by the way), we bolted down the hill to the finish line.......

QgPGXQqSwxhEAY5zUq3aCg.review_text: hmm....  3 flat screen tvs? amazing, spicy, bloody marys? one of the best, spiced, burgers in town? hot girls? not too expensive?  i guess i'll be watch a lot more sporting events here

_xejmoOW24MdCKFCIGqFpw.review_text: Monday Nights at Boardroom The Boardroom in North Beach (boardroomsf.com) has a very Chicago-style weekly special on wings. This is the kind of place I miss when I'm looking for the wing specials. Solid wings and a good beer, out the door minus a $20. The wings are good flavor, a bit saucy, and well cooked. Take a friend a split an order of 20. Its plenty to get all over the place and leave your fingers stanky danky in a good way. Hit it up. Definitely worth it. Finding a good seat might be tough, but its okay when all the people there are dingers just like yourself. itsawingding.blogspot.com

6ATfXxQLQuRAQ30-nLI6Yg.review_text: Sorry to smack this place down... specially since I'm a local but I just don't seem to have a good time.    Really small place, and a little too much trouble from the doorman (when I was there anyway)  for what it is.  The guy seriuosly accused my REAL id of being fake.  He threatened to call the cops, and I egged him on.  I guess my confidence came through cause he let me in.  I won't go as far as giving it 1 star, because I can't say antyhgin HORRIBLE happened here.  Come on a tuesday night and if trivia is your thing you'll have fun...  i'm a local and I NEVER want to go here.  When I do, i leave within 5 minutes... what else can I say?

cY2O_YfM_e45jkiYl4U3Sg.review_text: We came in last night for trivia and had a blast.  Service is great, considering how busy they were. $5 margaritas all night. ***I accidentally gave a lousy tip, I mean I did have 5 margs (but I felt really bad about this morning). So if you're reading this i promise to give you more the next time we are there (most likely next tuesday).  The food was delish too, grilled cheese and tomato soup and I split the bacon mac n cheese (only $6 for a big dish) it was amazing. I definitely want to try their brunch sometime.  The bar is pretty small so you wanna get there early if you are doing trivia to get a spot!  We will be back next week!!

MbrBwPdH1Qydr1urjW9ARg.review_text: I mean, when you're looking for a good bar, you want:  1) Cheap drinks? Check 2) Small crowd? Check 3) Anything that's wrapped in bacon? CHECK!! 4) Cool bartenders? Double check.  Great place to blackout on Sundays during COLTS GAMES!!  Go Horse!

_0rGBUP6QVsldXbiGbJH3A.review_text: Great place to have a drink and definitely have a bite to eat.  The food here is much better than in most pub / bar establishments.  The personality changes depending on the day and time.  It can be a lively music filled place, a play bingo and trivia place, a great bar to enjoy drinking with friends, and definitely  a place to enjoy some football or baseball.

dE9YaRaUtkDm-xJrW3BSPg.review_text: came here after dinner w some friends at firenze by night down the street.  its just another small sf dive.  at least there were no hipsters there.  bartender was friendly.

AoIqYDqqIk2pL5eS_abpCg.review_text: Boardroom is the perfect, sticky, delicious-bar-food-fried, fast beer and shots football bar I've been to in SF. It's a serious Arizona State University football bar too! A-S-UUUUUUUUUU!!!!

jfQFLfyFtSDsvlf5r-EiFw.review_text: I went here for Trivia Night and I wasn't that impressed. It might be because I love my old trivia joint and this just didn't cut it or it could be because the girl who runs it sucks at it. She needs an assistant or someone to help her host the thing. It takes too long for her to tally the questions and she comes up with the questions on her own so they are pretty narrow in range. It was also extremely crowded and not well suited for trivia. They had one round that was visual on the TV and the people in the back had to make their way to the other side of the bar to see it. It just wasn't as fun and carefree as the one I'm used to. Get there WAY early if you want to get enough space for a team of more than just you.  The bar itself is cool. A bit divey but has great personality and could be a cool hang out when it's not slammed with people. I'd probably go back to just socialize and drink on any other night...

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: I always feel silly reviewing bars and lounges, because often times it isn't the place itself that makes the experience, its the people you're with.    But in this case, they did serve food and I was around good company so this can't go wrong.    While waiting for our table at Tony's, our group decided to venture out for a drink.  I've been wanting to try the po boys and drink specials, so I decided to scope this place out.  it's not a huge spot, but the moment I walked in, I could already see me parking myself here every friday like my favorite local bar (if I lived around here of course).  The drink special they had was a $7 Fernet (or Jager) shot and PBR.  wow.  Just wow.  2 of those please for my friend (who has never had Fernet before) and I to get us loaded up to be unable to taste any goodness from Tony's Pizza.    We also decided out of starvation to munch on some Bacon Wrapped Tater Tots, Onion Rings, and Fries, your typical bar fares.  Delicious.  Nothing comes outside of expectations, unless you had walked in thinking you were in a gourmet restaurant where servers tend to your needs.  No.  This place gets you that greasy bar snack goodness and nothing disappointed.    We walked out merrily relaxed, and having satisfied a small episode of the munchies.  I'll have to return to this joint in the future for more.

7OfrRi-xGESQsBpJFrlfLA.review_text: this place holds a special spot in my heart--it's my local tuesday trivia spot.  I've been going every tuesday for over a month, and it never disappoints.  The vibe is nice and laid back, they serve seriously delicious $2 fish tacos, and the quiz itself is just right.  not too hard, not too easy, and always enjoyable.  my ONLY only only beef is that for some reason there is ALWAYS a line for the bathroom when I want to go, but i suppose this is out of management's control short of just adding more bathrooms. ;)  props also to the bartender who joined our trivia team last week!

gurcmVDESVQ8X20xpw4btw.review_text: Great sports bar. This place is no frills and a fantastic place to check out and watch a game.

yVZGQfKeBBYFElt-nsfxBQ.review_text: Who likes Trivia? I do I do! Tuesday night at the Boardroom are a must. Trivia night starts at 8:30. Drinks are cheap until 7 during happy hour and the 2$ chicken tacos were unbelizable (2 guys at the bar at the shirt on from Belize no joke!)  Con the bartender is awesome. Super friendly and his buddy bartender (can't remember name right now) hooked us up with a free round after refusing to help us with a trivia question. Definitely a good mid-week break in North Beach.  Oh yea, the Trivia host Laura is a gem as well.

KQZZHT9t1jwbItb-iQLIgQ.review_text: Was visiting from out of town and needed a great, friendly sports bar.  I came across the Boardroom via several reviews/posts from several site -Yelp included.  I showed up for some Thursday night NCAA football (GO Tigers!) and was pleasantly surprised with the vibe, service and food.    Kieth  was behind the bar and made sure the drinks were refilled quickly, food arrived promptly and he is happy to weigh-in with recommendations on the menu.  All-in-all a great venue and experience.  When I am back in SF I will be sure to return.

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: Golf pub crawl hole #5 ouf 9 (Saturday)  The word of the day is MUFFIN TOP.  Have you ever seen a person who tried to squeeze into a piece of clothing that was just too tight and over flows out of that garment?  Well trying to fit 40 people on a golf pub crawl in Woody Zips small frame when there are 20 drinkers already there is just like that.  I had a good time, but the quarters were muffin top.    The bartenders were friendly and the decor was nice.  I'd like to go when I have more room.

PbmtoKdQ_Td9Ez_WwlEZig.review_text: Everyone has their favorite bar.  This is my favorite in SF.  Why, you ask?  Reasonably priced drinks - particularly at Happy Hour. ($4 pints - some good stuff on tap)  They introduced me to Frenet.  Excellent service.  The bartenders are super cool and take the time to get to know their customers.  The patrons are always interesting - Definitely the 25-40 (mostly male), affluent/professional but not flashy set.  There are plenty of the fratty types, but I have yet to see the obnoxious variety (I'm looking at you, Wreck Room ;) )  I've had a lot of good conversations with folks while grabbing a few pints and watching games.  Generally, there are some gals there too.  It's a good sports scene.  I go for MNF and hockey games.  One of the bartenders is a Leafs fan.  Overall, it's a relaxing place to unwind and grab a few drinks with buddies, and a good place to pop in by yourself.  And, the food.  I love tater-tots!  They've got'em.  The sandwiches are all good - I'm a big fan of their burger ($10 if you get it with Cheddar and Bacon, with a side of tots).  I've tried the Pulled Pork, and that was also terrific.  They do Bacon-Wrapped Tater-Tots, which was actually how I found out about the joint.  Yes, they're great!  Also, for Happy Hour they do $4 tots and nachos (and, I believe they make their own chips - they're good.)    I won't hold the fact that it's an ASU bar against them  ;)

L9AJkS7jMhf8cYo3AE6rjQ.review_text: So what's not to like about this place.  It's becoming a favorite spot.  Jenn is great, she makes you laugh, and great drinks!

kIFja02Dxs7KdUHj_rY0nQ.review_text: Small, hole in the wall, neighborhoody, pub in the outskirts of North Beach. Good service, tasty bar bites, and bumpin' jams.   The bacon wrapped tatter tots are crispy and unique, and the nachos are humungous topped with everything you can think of!

GDnuRcvlkMRHJW1jqYIqpA.review_text: Couldn't give a shit about sports, but sweet potatoes with a huge dollop of sour cream?  Yes please!  Weekly food specials made us wish it were Sunday so we could have $5 chicken and waffles, but the $7 pulled pork was delicious enough that we didn't resent Thursday too much.  Corona buzz and tunes from my freshman year of high school FTW.  Will be back.

NA33m2bpLoNAaJWzV_2gsg.review_text: Great place to watch football. The bloody Mary's are amazing as well. This place has bacon wrapped tater tots... Enough said.

M1fW9PZfi07Mk5vXFkF6QA.review_text: I watched my beloved football team play, heard Alice in Chains over the sound system, and had greasy food handed to me by a complete smartass.  The Boardroom is what I hope for in a marriage.

Zk0RGkhWxcSlbsRzpu3DmA.review_text: I really want to make the Boardroom my new Moe's (See: Moe's Crosstown Tavern, Charleston, SC) but I just can't.   I love the homemade corndogs and the bacon wrapped tater tots are awesome, but the burger just doesn't do it for me.  Cheap drinks are a plus.  Check out the beer and shot specials including the dirty hipster - $6 for PBR and Jameson.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text:
Decent bar right around the corner from my place, so definitely convenient. I think they are having an identity crisis at the moment, trying to be all things to all people. However, I'm sure that will all settle and it'll just be another good bar. Until then you've got your Saturday/Sunday football games, foosball tournaments, Salsa Night, DJ Night, etc...
  Update: This also happens to be an OSU fan's safe haven. Since I grew in Columbus and lived there for more than half of my life, this is an added bonus...Go Bucks...

srhp1Zcf_rbhF4dIiPRYAg.review_text: Any bar that can hang with college and sunday football is worth 5 stars to me!  This bar is awesome.  I've now been there at least a 1/2 dozen times and I am constantly more and more impressed.  The bar staff can keep up with any crowd and is always with a positive attitude.   I will always applaud a bar that sells PBRs in bottles and plays the game.  I recommend going and and spend all your money because they are worth it!

AWnyRyhCx8upY8uJ5IH_DA.review_text: The bacon wrapped tots are the shiz but the BELT was dry and flavorless, lacking avocado and any perpetual longing for a future visit. The onion rings were decent and the one dude I met was friendly but Overall  this bar is good for the tots but lacks much else

WjvIGdLc7ZZpiux3P6xSEg.review_text: Decent sports bar. I came here for the first time last night for trivia. Bacon wrapped tater tots are good but kinda a rip off at $8 for like 10 of them....  I would come back though.

Tf7yUTBsqwEndz6XGYC74g.review_text: Trivia night is a lot of fun. I think the music and Movie questions were a little too hard but everything else was fun. We have never won the game but we did win a free bottle of Champagne for the most original name! It was George Carlin's 7 words!! You know the ones! :)

Q9ZzBvrzeVz1SMaj5kx7qA.review_text: I had not heard of Woody Zip's until I went to a party there last December and it was great. I have returned a few times since then and every time it has been one of the most pleasant and all around "happy" bars I've ever been in. Not only do they have great drinks, they also have really great food. Although the lowly corn dog may not be your thig, they make a homemade corn dog that is amazing. Great place to watch a game.

Vh3E8METhJzLBLTntO_jgg.review_text: My friend and I hit up the Boardroom on our Taco Tuesday Tour a couple weeks ago. Very friendly service.  The bar was nice and clean for this type of venue, kind of "sports bar meets dive" bar.  Good spot overall.  Definitely has that "everybody knows your name" vibe going for it. We also hit up Mojito (yelp.com/biz/mojito-san-…).  Happy hour and food prices were better at Mojito, by far, but the tacos tasted better at the Boardroom.  Their tacos rival Nick's any day, but their shrimp tacos can't be beat.

g-g0D2GIW8q2zV4sxKhfWA.review_text: After our prior incidents, I decided to give the Boardroom another chance.  After our wedding we decided to have a pub crawl throughout North Beach.  I contacted the owner about stopping by his bar for an hour or so.  He got back to me quickly and offered some decent drink specials including $3 bud light, a $6 hornitos Margarita, a $5 Three Olives Grape Vodka and soda, and a $3 shot specials.  This time the bartender was great - nice, attentive and quite the hard worker.  We brought in 35+ people and as the only bartender on staff she hustled to get us all drinks.  People waited a while, but it wasn't for her lack of effort.  Overall, it was a good experience and I would return.

QXAkmRjGJvLg3fX65A9oNQ.review_text: Woody Zips is a really cool neighborhood bar. I have been a few times now and I always have a good time. Bartenders are really friendly and pour some strong drinks. Not really sure I would call this place a sports bar, but if you are looking for a laid back place to have some drinks, I would recommend this place!!

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: So I came here for a Grouper.  If you're wondering what that is, just look it up.  LOL!  The vibe was actually great for the Grouper.  We got a table in the back and ordered drinks and some snacks.  The servers/bartenders were awesome and it was a great place to have a conversation.  It wasn't too loud and i never felt like I had to shout to be heard.  My only regret is I never tried the bacon wrapped tots!  Next time?

Lt1t_ukRbcI2tdx7-1RgeA.review_text: so - so  jukebox didnt work - (or wasn't on), tacos were aight (i think they made me and my buddy sick that night but who knows), bartender was cool, didn't stay for trivia. even at its most packed, it didnt seem annoying so this would be a good place for a chill, relaxed night.

5pBi1CSpm9467jh7PSBDkA.review_text: As you can tell from most of my reviews, rarely do I venture into the North Beach area.  In fact, this might be my only review from there?  Hmmm, interesting.  I came here with my friend Misha K. (who drives, which is probably the only way I'd end up in North Beach in the first place) He'd recommended taco tuesdays.  (Little did I know it was Tequila, Taco, Trivia, Tuesdays)  We were sort of early enjoying our DELICIOUS cheap beef tacos. (I'm usually a chicken person, but the beef was way better!)  Then the trivia night started up and it started to get crowded.  But in a good way, it wasn't packed, but maybe just...cozy.  So pleasant surprise, we were in the lead the first round of trivia, so we decided to order another round of beer and tacos and stay for the next group of questions.  Mmmmm.  Such a fantastic surprising night for a Tuesday!  I'm totally going back.

JFTt8rdVR9IY6Gilp-xEGA.review_text: You almost wouldn't notice Woody Zips just walking by, and I even had a hard time finding it when I was actually looking for it. That just makes it all the more fun, because the people there meant to come, and have probably been there many times before. It's tiny, but the jukebox is always cranking and the bartenders are partying right along with you. A round of shots for the whole bar is a regular occurrence. Definitely a lot more character than your normal 'dive' bar, and always a wild time.

NHKJowBM-8mY2Iegfc87pQ.review_text: Time: 9:07pm/59°F clear  Purpose: Needed to find a nearby bar to catch the last half of the warriors/cavaliers game without being notice alot. Didn't feel like walking around saying hi to everyone like a town mayor as I know most of the businesses nearby, just didn't feel like talking much.  Ambiance: Small neighborhood joint were the owners knows everyone by their names. Even if you don't know much about the place you will when you leave. Not much going on here it's all about locals stopping by for a drink or so. Since it's small place when there's Giant's or 49er's you will have to use a megaphone to reach someone across the room. 4-5 flatscreen spread through the place nice wooden bar counter with smooth contour groove sit about 12+ at bar if you counter the ends too. A dartboard lot's of pennants and posters articles of local teams some trophys but couldn't get close enough to read the plaque.   Staff: Guy at counter was nice greeted me how you doing? I sat down he said I've seen you around before and I answer I bet you have. We started talking about the upcoming 2014 season for the Giant's.  Cleanliness: It's a bar/restaurant type so I can't say it was clean or not as some areas maybe opposite of what a business should be, let's say I will eat here again.  Eats/Drinks: Order wings $9 and thinking about the bacon wrap tots. Not a fan of fried food but once in a while, yes. Not really sure as I was watching only second half of the game. So bartender walks off and brought me 5pcs on the house. Thank you! Quite delicious. Wash it down with speakeasy $6 including tips.  Products: Mostly finger foods that are easily made in matter of minutes, deep frying. Wings,tots,bacon wrap tots,nachos,sweet pototo fries,hummus, chips/dips,onion rings etc.  Punch Lines: Neighborhood bar,chinatown,little Italy,SFPD Central Station,parking garages,funeral home,Washington square park,fisherman wharf,cafes,italian restaurants,muni buses,post office,banks,delis,trinket shops,coit tower (closed for remodeling),Russian hill,Fairmont hotel,Mark Hopkins hotel.  Tradeoffs: A nearby friendly environment for the locals to meet up or socialized.  Final Thoughts: Don't get me wrong it's a cool place it's just the menu options and noise level is unbearable. I understand it's a sports bar too. Guy yaps on his phone probably to no one because he was to drunk to recognized there's no one on the other side. Those ghost calls can really mess you up pair with drinking. The kind that you think it's vibrating picks up phone no call inbound so you yap about your day to no one. I will come back again with my Giant's/49er's jerseys depending on sports season.

krhueH9uihxVjhhDNcqi5g.review_text: The hopes of a breakfast at Mama's were squashed when it was after 11:00 AM so obviously the line was even more absurd than expected, so we yelped this spot.  My boyfriend thought I was crazy as we were wandering through North beach and show up at a seemingly divey bar.  I pleaded my case, "they get great reviews!!!" :D so we walked in and were greeted by the bartender who gave us great suggestions for breakfast and made fresh pureed fruit bellinis. (melon, kiwi, champagne = perfection)  I ordered the breakfast sandwich with tots of course and boyfriend got the eggs, sausage and tots.The meals took some time to prepare, which during that time we got to taste their home made bloody mary mix, irish cream and pickled green beans ~ the bartender (I am blanking on your name!) was so friendly and everyone in the bar was having a great time.  Followed up our breakfasts with some Strongbow and was a perfect start to our day.  P.S. Found out this is one of the few 49ers bars in the city so it's packed on game days!

obd2ZozY9RJL8t_hSyJDKg.review_text: So i totally love playing games and the fact that their is a bar that provides a fun trivia night is totally SWEET. . . the trivia was entertaining and somewhat informative. Sometimes it was hard to hear cuz everyone was talking and i did see people cheating which takes a litle bit of the fun out of it. but the $2 tacos looked really good. . .  however. . . they do NOt pour their drinks very strong. My first drink was strong but for some reason he thought i wouldn't notice that the second one was not. . . not sure why bartenders do this. It's not gonna make me less drunk i;m just not gonna order drinks from here.Just pour me the same drink EVERYTIME. If you don't i'm gonna be a grummpy drunk NOT a HAPPY drunk. I have to say though if your into cheap beer this is the place to go.  The establishment itself is not very big so get their early if your going for trivia. And they are guilty of my biggest pet peive... not having the coat hooks under the counters to put your purse or jacket. BIG FAIL THERE. It was really stuffy and hot. as far as the crowd it's North beach...need i say more

V7VAbouEnCt39fsA1MM6RA.review_text: Best Kick-Ass Bloody Mary Ever - That's all that needs to be said - Thank You.

y1GXDMOmu4lnsCI7TSi0sg.review_text: been here many times and love this place. always have drink specials and good place to watch 49er football. went for GB vs SF and this place was standing room only and it was loud and crazy. people spraying beer all over the bar , groups of people hammered as fuck at 1230pm .   Try a shot of fireball, it will blow your mind!!!!!  The morning bruch area lookeed sketchy....not only the food but placment of the setup, like someone could get raped back there!!

Ae1atVuqSF8r5QkchacXVg.review_text: I rarely give 5 stars, but this place fuckin rocks. Last night was the first time we went there for trivia night, having heard very good things about it, and boy it did not disappoint. The tacos were solid, and for 2 dollars each you could eat to your heart's content- I prefer the steak. The trivia girl was hilarious and pretty wasted, while the bartender knew what he was doing and didn't hate on us despite wearing A's gear in a giants bar.  Another star for the multi-media (pictures and music) trivia night. ANOTHER plus was that we won a bottle of champagne for best name (mustache rides are free).  the one caveat to this was the fact that parking is always awful in north beach, and it took us about 20 minutes to find parking. Outside of that, the boardroom rules and we likely will come back next Tuesday!

Hi2u6Rz_i6fOOe5SoYO6GQ.review_text: A whoop whoop is what I give the Boardroom. This is one of my favorite bars in SF. Of course I have a slight bias because I live across the street but it truly is a great atmosphere and always has fun people...   Oh and definitely check out Taco's Tuesdays! The tacos are to die for... :)

UuxiH2oLycDhMv7TKQ5EVw.review_text: The Boardroom is a bar I really wanted to dislike, and I know that sounds mean but I'll tell you why.   The bar that is The Boardroom was once the bar that was Woody Zip's. Sure the name might not have been as clever but Woody Zip's had, and I @#$% you not, the best Buffalo Wings I have ever had. Ever. I don't know what happened or why the name went, but those oh so epic wings went with it.  And alas, all was lost.   So I when I returned to this bar with quite the humbug attitude, just looking for a reason to rail on it, I found that it's still a super fun North Beach spot.   Despite it being a small space, the place can get super busy on the Friday / Saturday nights. Loud music and large groups are a staple. The bartenders are really nice and super fun, the folks in here are typically friendly and having a great time. The place is essentially just like the bar I remember it to be, minus those golden god-like wings.  The food here is still pretty damn good bar food and they have some good happy hour specials too.   So, as much as I don't want to admit the new girl is just as much fun as the old flame I had, I'll give The Boardroom a thumbs up.    Dear Woody Zips, we'll always have our wings   xoxox  ~Andy

fU6DKMw5aPmIEkSi_6iLZA.review_text: I really love this bar! Great service, cool local vibe, yummy food, specialty drinks, and a hip atmosphere. I'll definitely go back--probably many many times.

6zjoJQiv9m5ww99PhKTqFw.review_text: Simple happy hour menu. $6 for a can of Tecate and a shot of Jager...order a few and you'll be feeling very happy. Add some tater tots for $3 and you're good to go. Well drinks are $4. They have about 5-6 beers on draft.   I don't recommend the original po' boy. It's a sandwich with fries, small bits of pulled pork and gravy all smothered in the middle. I imagined it to be meatier. But it basically turned out to be gravy and fries between two slices of bread.   The bartender was very friendly. He continued to give us happy hour prices even though it was past 7pm. You won't get your tourist crowd here for sure. It's definitely a locals joint.

UxJoHsSFqc3TcM6UkIPmeA.review_text: This is a really good spot on any North Beach pub crawl. I've been here a few times and it's never too crowded. The staff is generally pretty cool and pretty efficient. This is the most neighborhoody bar in the area though....which is great. It helps keep a lot of the douchers away.  Every time I go in to that place though, I can't think of anything but the great times I had there when it was "Shannon's" and Katrina was the smokin' hot blond behind the bar.

GO0GU6sTOdgtUpAwzj1Tbg.review_text: Cool little bar with a lot of locals,  din't try the food so can't say but went on Trivia night and it was full and it seem fun.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: I don't know why I didn't find this bar earlier!    It's the perfect size for a neighborhood hangout: (the size of a large room!), the staff is nice, they serve some light food and snacks (tater tots, corn dogs, hummus, fish tacos, fish and chips), the drinks are not expensive and it's not a super young or old crowd (ie. late 20s to young 30s to young 40s).    Now I have somewhere else to go to in North Beach! Yay!

tmxIsLKcNd9qG6nbL6ONbg.review_text: Was in here on a chill Wednesday night. Scanning the beers, I was unsure what to order. I noticed one tap I didn't recognize and the bartender noted it was a Firestone Pale Ale that he highly recommended. I figured I'd see if he was worth his word and was pleased that he was. They'll give it to you straight here and give you something good.

Bx1iLCgUyu4HPepkYut4Uw.review_text: I love this place. Bartenders are great, drinks are cheap and strong, tots are delicious. This place will treat you like a regular even if it's your first time there.  I feel like I have been looking for a bar like this for years... so glad I finally found it!

Ppm_nqivtMfP4eFIvOm19A.review_text: A little loud, but the unpretentious atmosphere, interesting drink options and really good food made up for it, especially the surprisingly good tacos (no, seriously, they're magically delicious, sober or not).  Drinks are cheap too, vodka sodas are $5, or $3 during happy hour (5p-7p and 10p-11p).  Trivia night is reeeaaaallllyyy hard - our little team of 3 (Hi Emily!) actually held our own, all things considered, but we still got our asses handed to us, particularly in the movie round.  We've resolved to come back with a vengeance, hopefully with more people.    It's not Kennedy's, but it too is worth the trek out from my usual haunts.

sqCZoVjchcwCsv5i8xPRWQ.review_text: Delicious food, fabulous mimosas, amazing Bloody Caesars, and a hysterical bartender.   Thanks Martin for helping us on our Sunday Funday brunch

mQJWWzmsYXwZ56P76UZ6dA.review_text: First time here and I already love this place.  Not particularly close to my neighborhood but so worth the extra distance.  First of all, the people who work there were awesome and friendly.  Second, we were there for the Ohio vs. Michigan game and my husband (and son) were thrilled to see so many Buckeye fans.  Third, we only made it through the appetizer menu but it was a good indicator of how good the rest of the menu is (look forward to trying more).  And fourth, our friend who came with swears by the Hornitos margaritas.  So, good job you guys.  Keep up the good work!

WhXRtsr8_hGb-gRGS-BzsA.review_text: The Boardroom was a great place to watch a few of the Bowl games today. Tots!? Excellent.

KKdBQXnUlVUZ0ZNTfMQoEA.review_text: Why do I constantly want to call this place Zippy Woods instead Woody Zips? It's irrelevant I suppose...but still. I went to this place for the first time last night, which happened to be an infamous Taco Trivia Tuesday. You have to give it to them - the tacos were AMAZING. Both the beef and chicken ones were phenomenal. It was completely unexpected and highly appreciated.   I actually really loved this place. The bar was low-key but alive, the people were not tourists or the over-the-top locals that crawl North Beach at night. They were local people, at a local bar, for a local night of trivia and whatever. The customers were great and were willing to talk to strangers and meet new people.  The bar itself is pretty decent and has a good, small selection of beers including Boont Amber, Guinness, Blue Moon, Red Stripe. They even saluted the neighborhood and had Moretti La Rossa in bottles. The bartender, an interesting fellow named Blake, was pleasant and all about customer service. He wasn't particularly talented, but I truly appreciated the effort and care he put into his job.   There are a few widescreen plasmas and it's probably a decent place to watch a game. The music was also worth mentioning - what other bar you know plays mid-90's Filter and STP and then switches over to 40's pop? And how could I not give at least 4 stars to a place with a neon Sharks jersey beer sign in the window?

I6WPzpvgWD87Kx-KGJcGCA.review_text: I *HEART* Taco Tuesdays.  Mmmmmm..... More than that, they have at least one Deschuttes Brew on tap at any point in time (at least the bartender said so, so it better not change!).  I think the word is getting out though, so we have got to get another guy in the kitchen to get those tacos whipped up!  And maybe another to pour beers :) Definitely a cool happy hour spot.

XSFEo51pwEoNRGri4z2LjQ.review_text: As one of my new year's resolutions, I've decided to start writing reviews regularly rather than being a Yelp leech.  So I'm starting with the Boardroom, where I watched the BCS Championship game.  With no specific loyalties, it was fun to watch at what was clearly an Oregon bar.    Best thing about the place is their food.  Being a vegetarian, food at bars usually sucks, but their wild mushroom melt was delicious.  Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever gotten.  Good drink specials during the game too with $2 Coors Light tall cans and some weird $2 Hef deal that lasted about a minute.  Minus one star for pretty filthy bathrooms.

2_cvh63d0CM33n1cP-3YZA.review_text: This place is so fantastic. The bartenders are the nicest around and the food is great. I originally discovered this place because they tended to be a Saints/LSU bar. Now the sports team of choice changes more frequently, but I still love coming.   Went over the weekend and had the corndogs (delish), and hung out with the bartender. He was super friendly, and even gave us suggestions of what bar to go to next since we had a friend from out of town we were showing around. Definitely a must do if you're in the North Beach area.

8wNfJCqBYC_8xMDZjnMyuw.review_text: I'll make it brief:  Good jukebox, fun neighborhood peeps, and super friendly bartenders. Good bar food, too! I still need to try their brunch...

Z9boj3QdTXyw4glpJ84Cog.review_text: It's a dive bar in a neighborhood with dive bars.  We didn't have any food, but ya know, saw a lot of people eating food that we didn't really want to try.  The service was nice and all, but we wanted to check out.  Questions to ask before you enter: - Do you like dive bars? - Do you want to drink for cheap? - Do you want to have a good time?  If you answered yes to one or any of these, enter The Boardroom at your own risk.

EhAXMJuRwnhQKzXbPqPN6g.review_text: I found this place last Tuesday on Yelp randomly and went for Trivia Night on a fluke. I got there ridiculously early coming straight from work, but Mr. Bartender Keith made me feel welcome while I waited for my teammate (even though I was alone and looked like a loser- couldn't even call my voicemail and pretend to be on the phone because this place is where the T-Mobile signal goes to die).  There were only 2 of us so I am proud to say we didn't suck terribly, but the trivia definitely makes you use your brain. We even won a bottle of champagne for our team name (but I think Keith was just being extra nice!) 2 dollar tacos and tecate, I'm sold. I'll be back tonight with a bigger and better team!  **Update** 9/4/08  Went back this past Tuesday and won! yay for team trig & track!

Rd_k48XNACxaSBN0D8uk3Q.review_text: Great place to catch a game (what ever sport you want to see). There are at least 5 tvs inside. Its a casual local bar that can get packed depending on the day.   Goods good, had the tachos - tater tot nachos. they came out piping hot with lots of steak. A great price for the amount of food.   The bloody marry was good, some spiciness to it with olives, peppers and green bean vs a celery stalk. YUM

3F4jxfkqZN76wZuSF2OAaw.review_text: Winning the trivia match the first night we ever set foot in The Boardroom had us hooked.  Tuesday night $2 Tiger Beers also got me hooked.  A wandering dog in a bar is a good sign.  Keith is freaking awesome.

9lKCs1d4AE5eOmtIpuviAA.review_text: An "ASU bar" but don't have the PAC-12 network. ? nuff said.  This makes me sad.  #GoDevils #getthepac12networksoon

IxKjgqLAG6teY_pqGnh9ZQ.review_text: I am really happy that The Boardroom is just around the corner from my apartment.  I am not so happy that I've only been there once, but my first experience was awesome!  After a quick dinner at Mo's, Luis and I met up with some cool yelpers at The Boardroom last Tuesday for $2 beer special/tacos and Trivia Night.  I agree with Mr. Luis, we should have just had dinner at The Boardroom, too -- the menu looked good and how could I have turned down tater tots and fish tacos?!?!  Will definitely try food next time...  We arrived a little before eight, bar wasn't as crowded as we expected.  A few Yelpers already stationed along side the bar.  Drinks were ordered.  $6 for a can of Olympia beer and a shot of Jager... tempting, but no thank you.  I had Mirror Pond Ale all night long.  More people arrive, our Yelp team got bigger so we had to split in two different teams before trivia started.    Trivia.  7 Categories.  Current Events.  Naming the Person's name by looking at a printed picture. Pop Culture. Music clips. Commonalities (things words have in common). Movie clips. Random category.  70 Questions total.  Rule number 1 is do not yell out the answer.  Rule number 2 is no cheating (aka: using iPhones to get answers).  Rule number 3 is DO NOT YELL OUT the answer.  Simple enough.  The host is great, she had to remind a few people about the rules and had a bit of trouble with the microphone.    Trivia lasted for a while, maybe about an hour and a half.  In the end, my team lost by a couple of points.  But hey, we still won a $25 bar tab for the best team name... "A Colin in the Barack is worth two in the Bush."  Can't complain.  Good food and drink specials, great service, nice casual bar and an interesting crowd.  I'm so disappointed that I'm not here more often.  One of my 2009 New Year Resolution will be to go to The Boardroom more often -- that'll be an easy resolution that I can keep all year, I think.

0E7L58EyWJV5mOC4qxvjXg.review_text: North Beach Burger.... Heyyyyyylllll-YEAH!! Cured pancetta, fried egg on organic Black Angus? With sweet potato fries? I licked that plate clean.   Free WIFI so I can finish this review...   Great photography on the wall, large prints depicting extreme sports. Being a photographer I can totally appreciate the quality wide angle work on the basketball scene, the cool skateboard shadow shot and snow sports action sequences. I can't believe I left this out of my first review, since it's a big reason I kept coming back in the first place.

zB_LS3R978pzNw2wosFYBQ.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
zB_LS3R978pzNw2wosFYBQ.review_text: Best bar food I've had in a long time, and especially in NB. Justin get's it done, and it's always delish...  And the bartenders are great, too, especially Casey, Sal and Ben. It's a real "neighborhood-y" bar, they get to know you and treat you like regulars all the time. Makes you wanna come back just to say hello, but then you end up staying all night! :)  Keith, the owner, is a great guy and also takes the time to get to know his customers.  Easily, my favorite bar in NB.

gIAsnmMNxffdh6BQt1rtXg.review_text: Nice spot with cheap drinks, happy hour and trivia night.

NUyMCIlRHqZ6BvgtVPXqZQ.review_text: Its a low key place to watch some games.  I went during NCAA tournament and everyone was very into the games which was appreciated.  Good beer, but their mixed drinks were pretty poorly made.  We had the hummus appetizer which was good.  Guy to girl ratio was as expected for a sports bar ....in san francisco :-\.

O2qAlgUHKft3Lm-hPqO7rA.review_text: On the way home after an evening in North Beach, we decided to stop in and have a drink at Northstar. I always used to walk by Woody Zips on the way but never went in. As we passed once again, we spontaneously decided to try something different and headed inside.  I've heard that Woody Zips is somewhat of a dive, but it was decorated really well with flat screens, great lighting, cool artwork and colorful painted walls. The beer selection was decent and so cheap- $3 for a draft pint! I got to talking with the bartender Luke and discovered that he is one of the owner's of Woody Zips. He and the other owner live above the bar and named the place after their fathers. After talking some more, he showed us their upstairs private room that can be rented out, which reminds me of Butter's private room- it looks like more like an apartment than a bar.  The clientele was very relaxed and not many people were there, which was exactly what I was seeking in a Wednesday evening. Swapping stories with the bartender (Luke told me about Spec, the old man who owns Specs and can still be seen there) and relaxing with my friend made for a great night. I really feel that this place could become my "neighborhood bar" and can't wait to return.

-h9oaqGRjqH5nzTUD9hgOQ.review_text: I have only experienced Woody Zips on a Tuesday evening (for Two-Dollar Taco Trivia Tuesdays) - but based on Tuesdays alone, the place is a lot of fun. It's pretty small and cozy, and after only going to trivia for a few weeks, you'll get to know everyone that's working there. The tacos are definitely yummy and the trivia is a lot of fun (the trivia starts at 8:30 and normally goes from anywhere around 10 to almost 11 - seven rounds including 10 minute music and movie rounds take time). Also, the drinks are reasonably priced and after trivia ends get even cheaper!

ZkDuFhYbYnZw3EiPSlKjdw.review_text: This place is a wanna-be North Beach bar....No locals, a bunch of lame ass games to try to draw in the under age crowd, a TERRIBLE juke box,  the bar tenders are not friendly and they let their friends steal wallets off the bar.  This place needs to find a new home in the marina right under the Golden Gate.

XRmnHVEWW79N_odOei8PGg.review_text: This Bar just gets it. Everything is what it should be. The drinks are cheap and good. The bar tender with long hair from Canada offers great suggestions and gives relevant info to what you came for.   The burger is hands down the best I've had in the 2 years in SF. Pssst they're ground fresh, in-house WITH BACON INSIDE!  I'm all for dive bars, but I'd still like to have a sanitary bathroom to use when nature calls and the Boardrooms is fully stocked, clean and in working order. Ah feels good to have a clean place to wash up.  Trivia nights on Tuesdays are fun, music can be controlled via your cell phone app.   The list goes on and on about how everything is done right. Non-pretensious bar sure to provide a good time every time.   Next time I'm in the mood for another burger I'll be at Boardroom baby :-)   -Cheers

JUX2gRlYLsztq36c4qpbWA.review_text: very good food, great bar selections, friendly service!  I wouldnt really call it a sports bar except for the fact that yes, you can see sports on the TV...4 plasmas i might add..just doesnt have a sports bar vibe, much nicer that way if you ask me...lets see, burger was great, fried macorni and cheese balls were a first, also delicious...and the steak and blue cheese salad was perfect....good dressing, sauteed onions, hard to beat!  highly reccommenenededded

BPyUJD12lmsE8IaxzJCeXQ.review_text: beer shot beer shot beer shot beer beer beer...perked!

RvVNfrVXso5NClIPbWl95w.review_text: Open till 2am!!!!!  You can actually order cooked bacon as an appetizer or get the bacon wrapped tator tots.  12 for $8

mtl9Z6oZg9mUuyl96J8xBg.review_text: Great place, nice atmosphere.  Not your normal beer soaked sports bar.  I reccomend sampling all the great tequilas they have behind the bar and if you're an Ohio State fan the place is OFF THE HOOK on gamedays.  They also have Trumer Pilsner which is brewed in Berkeley, a super local brew that I cant find anywhere else.  The food is good too, a nice and surprising twist on normal bar food, burgers, wings...try the Black & Blue skirt steak, it's a killer!

F1bpfqIj0XWF73YUWrZ4Rg.review_text: I'm not going to lie, one of my favorite things about this place is that many times there is an adorable dog wandering around wanting to be pet. The bar itself is great too, the bartenders are friendly and they will always put on whatever sports game you want to watch-- this seems to be kind of our go-to place for Sharks games. The bartenders will engage with you, cheer and talk about the game, which is nice. Its also one of the few places in North Beach that has legitimately tasty bar food. Their chicken tenders are drenched in sauce, their hummus is super flavorful and their cheesy tater tots (that's right I said CHEESY) are freaking delicious!  But seriously, the dogs are SO cute.

zPhDGOunNrVjnBd8zQ93bg.review_text: Great place for Tuesday Trivia Night! The girl who runs it is really nice and does a great Job. They have super cheap Tecate and PBR! The tacos here are also outstanding.

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: Basic north beach bar. Nothing fancy, but gets the job done. The food menu was a little on the pricey side...$8 for seven mozzarella sticks?!?!

mN1WgreTn_1Ltk0kHKUqdg.review_text: The night I helped my buddy move in to North Beach, we decided to head out for a cold one or two (or twelve), and we started checking out the local options. I wasn't too impressed with most of the places, the sort of overcrowded overpriced bars that seem to be everywhere these days. Thankfully we found The Boardroom that night and it's become one of my favorites ever since.  It's the sort of place that makes you feel like a regular even on your first time in. You don't need to fight through the crowds of reprobates to get up to the bar, and the prices are right where they should be. People aren't there misbehaving and acting like it's the first time they've been to a bar, even if they are more than a little lit up.  We were on a liquid diet that night, but have been back dozens of times since, and the food is darn tasty. I'm convinced that the bacon wrapped tater tots may have saved my life on Superbowl Sunday. A good find.

KofmcukQnRz9mjKOS0u66g.review_text: Boardroom is amazing.  There are a ton of reasons to go,but let me list the top 4:  1- the food is AMAZING.  Try the beef brisket sandwich with tots- its phenomenal  2- Martin the bar tender is awesome 3- prices really decent for North Beach 4- the make a killer Moscow Mule... You can't find a decent one in NB anywhere.  Go, get the brisket sandwich, you'll thank me later.

J0G7SAItOT4opuLSK2-tmw.review_text: Came here to eat dinner...not to drink, caus I kind of love bar food. I got the grilled cheese and tomato sandwich, with some tater tots. It was pretty delicious, but on par for bar food. Also kind of expensive. I tried some of my friend's bacon wrapped tator tots and they were also pretty good, but I'm not sure it's worth the price for a small platter. I know that most people here come to drink and watch sports on TV, not to eat, so I don't think it's too fair to judge them by the speediness of their food preparation (which was on the slower side) - BUT, they were really accommodating about letting us change the channels on the TVs to watch what (sports game) we wanted to, which I thought was cool.

u7e2HMYEeAHaBhDIIK2HSg.review_text: Yummy beers on tap! And tater tots!!! The bartenders are ALWAYS really nice, I love it here. It's also stumbling distance from Rogue. Yay! If you want to drink somewhere in North Beach and feel like a local I say come here. They also have brunch now? Great! Play that silly dice game and enjoy a fairly priced alcoholic beverage. It's super clean, unpretentious, relaxing. Conclusion: perfect for weekdays, great hole in the wall.

IRsI8mkBLpJTMuYL2uz6vw.review_text: Okay, so the owner/manager reached out to me in response to my 1-star review with a sincere apology for my experience and urged me to come back and try The Boardroom again. Since he took the time to reach out and address me as a dissatisfied customer, and because it looks like this place does well the majority of the time, I'll be sure to try them again if I am in the area. Thank you for taking the time to address my concerns.

56ZnoSnnI8Bdf7_dBmSOtw.review_text: This place is basically a one stop shop for hangover treatment. Delicious, greasy food. Cheap drinks. Good bartenders. Great jukebox. The type of place that makes it easy to turn breakfast into an all-day bar hangout.

m_dpeYKcVRdCoQIVJ6DoOA.review_text: Great neighborhood bar! Love the crowd that has been coming here for years. Good snacks too!

mdNgxuT9Geph2ZL5lDam0g.review_text: So I really wasnt goin to go out on St Patty's Day but it was a long week at work I think I deserve one nite of being shit faced.  Just finished having dinner and a bunch of soju before heading over here to meet up with some friends.  It is very true the place is not very big so it just makes it even that better getting cozy up to ur neighbor. From the door guy to the bartenders were a good group of guys...especial Ben who for some reason seemed to like to give me a hard time out of my group.  But then again my group was kinda hard to handle taking up that whole corner near the window singing and taking pics. The crowd for being st. patty's was actually very laid back and merry...no drunk fools acting up and causing fights (aka Molly Magee's). I am truly sorry Ben for my friends and how loud we were but then again thanks for that cup of water u over flowed onto the bar...lol...were u tryin to get me wet? But thanks for the hug. It was a good nite...i got the bruises to prove it!

z-kyHYF6oUad7inUVG0Mzw.review_text: Well, I live across the street from this place and I constantly use their TV's as my personal cable.  The bartenders, Casey and Martin, are great guys and their service is always on point.  The owner Keith, has done a great job at making a great bar. There are so many great things to say about this place, let me try: -They make their own Bloody Mary mix -The food is really damn good -Their drink specials are great -Taco Tuesdays -$2 Tecate -$3 PBR  I suggest this as a spot to grab a bite and watch sports, or have a pub crawl and get shithoused.    Go, enjoy yo' self, be merry!!!

MFZAJCjeogRcavL7pvU6yQ.review_text: Attentive but relaxed bar staff who garnishes their conversation with a lavish amount of sarcasm. I approve!!!  The burger was definitely bacon infused and my friends order of buffalo chicken tenders was an exceptionally large portion.  I live in the neighborhood and will return to grab a beer and/or sample their *apparently* amazing Sunday Brunch.   The bartender was kind enough to let me sample his Bloody Mary mix, and it wasn't half bad...next time, I'll try it "all the way".

CTCDuqyqU2NsGnjIzEQNng.review_text: Very friendly bartenders, good sports on TV, surprisingly delicious food (no offense to the establishment, but it is a bar) and nice people. Small enough to make a new bud each time you step out for a smoke break. Have a great time everytime we go.

o0oxyu1qnQrutZo1GCGwMw.review_text: Pretty cool place to meet some friends on a Tuesday night to do some trivia. They keep the questions moving which is nice so the game doesn't last till 1am like some trivia nights and he has some interesting twists to the game which will keep your attention. It's very small so you need to get there about an hour before hand to get one of few tables (on a Tuesday). They have some food as well and i have heard it's decent i have just never found myself hungry there. The nachos looked awesome though i have to admit.  They have some nice TVs as well and they have the Sunday ticket so you can enjoy watching your team here.

EwRbT2_nkVkpxouNGjJkjw.review_text: Hands down.  Keith, the owner, has tailored made a bar that blends a bit of North Beach, a non-cliche sports spot and a local feel that makes you feel at home right away. Every time I have taken friends here, we walk away with that special feeling that only a Tiger beer and Russett & Sweet Potato fries can provide. Be there for Taco Tequila Tuesday Trivia and embrace a hound of locals playing plus enjoying great drink specials. Since it is a smaller spot, I recommend taking a large group with you so and your friends can be the party... as it should be every time you go out.

EhkhoHspemIjxO445XXAjw.review_text: I'm in San Francisco for two days so I decided to search Yelp for a good bar to watch the playoffs. All the reviews here said this was the place to be. The bartender seemed to favor the people sitting at the bar who appear to be locals, and was a tad rude. Breakfast Po' Boy wad very tasty and the Bloody Mary I ordered was perfect. I got my hopes up a bit for The Boardroom so we're leaving at half time to find another place. 3 stars

aBlXIipUwzl3wCIFIrFY-g.review_text: Went here just for the bacon wrapped tots...they were so good! The price of them..not so good. Guess we just missed the happy hour prices when we went. $8 for about 10 tots...kinda not worth it. We got 2 orders so $19 for meh maybe 20? Nope, not worth it in my opinion.  Liked the large amount of seating though and the other food looked yummy too.

Tl-GyMHOViQBtqQ1ODehfg.review_text: Kitty corner from North Star, this place gets a lot of the spill over from the hopping corner bar. I, however, think The Boardroom is much better.  I consider this my go-to neighborhood bar. Keith (the owner) is awesome, and he really takes care of the locals. I like going here for Oregon Duck games if I don't want to fight the R-Bar crowd. I had my last birthday party here, and I would probably have every next one here. Keith let me do drink specials, which were named after me.  If you email Keith, he's very responsive. He loves to have special events, so he's great about working with different folks on what they want.  They also have:  --Bloody Mary bar and bottomless mimosas on the weekend --Delicious tacos --A hummus plate, for a nice healthy option

NZwGgyT2BVjfWm6h-orOrw.review_text: A solid, local neighborhood bar with a great atmosphere. My go-to for 49ers football. The bar food is damn good too. I've had a burger, veggie burger, breakfast chroizo tacos, and the famous bacon-wrapped tots--all are really, really good. Solid bloody mary's as well, albeit a little pricey at $8.  Order a PBR and guess the playing card number/suit that's underneath the cap and they'll pay for your beer. I actually won the last time I was there.

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: Before my friend moved to Chicago, he used to frequent this place.  I wish that I had joined him more often.  This place is so good and dangerously close to home.  Attended a party here on a weeknight when I'm sure that it was much busier than usual, but I was extremely impressed with the quality of the service.  Bartender is extremely friendly and kept everyone's glass at least half full throughout the night.  Best surprise was the bar food.  In my opinion, its some of the best bar food in the city.  Tater tots in North Beach?  A fierce looking meatloaf sandwich.....the cuisine features all the comforts of your Midwest native roots, which are of course  best in moderation.  Can't wait to return for the chicken and waffles!

ePLlR7P2eYOXlZgN-MEHhw.review_text: This is an excellent neighborhood bar/dive. Its small and pretty bare bones with old booths and beer buckets that hold utensils and condiments. We walked here for a quick drink and bite to eat before flying out on Sunday. All of our plates were under $10 and the Bloody Mary was awesome.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: I have mixed emotions about The Boardroom. On the one hand, it's in North Beach, a place I love, the staff is incredibly kind, they play great music, and have lots of big TVs for ample sports viewing.   On the other hand, it smells like my college boyfriend's shared dorm apartment, ie, dirty towels and bong water, trivia night was a huge bust as the hostess was absolutley schwaaasted (like blurting out answers to trivia questions and heckling some guys in the crowd), the place is very tiny and dark, and last but not least (and at no fault of the establishment) we were infultrated by the *biggest douchebags* I have encountered in a while - seriously, they ate the better part our nachos and bacon mac n' cheese and got really angry when we told them to stop and moved our food away.  Me and the girlies started off the day yesterday in high spirits, looking forward to Dr Teeth's Tuesday Trivia / Two-for-One Maragarita deal / Two Dolla Taco fest, only to have our dreams squashed roadside after we learned that *Dr Teeth NO LONGER DOES TRIVIA* (fyi, y'all). So we had to resort to other options. Boardroom is somewhere between all of our offices, so we landed there.   Rita I and I got there waaaay before the trivia rush and planted ourselves at one of the two long tables and filled ourselves with a Margarita and a Corona ($5 each) and waited for our homegirls to grace us with their presence. I had the Fernet and Tecate deal for $6 which was pretty sweet.  Now kiddies, I welcome you to flashforward a few hours to almost trivia time. We were joined by some random menfolk from Canada who made a good impression - at first. Then they proceeded to take and eat our food and tried to justify it. Um, I hate you. Thankfully the staff saw what was happening and took the charge off our bill and put it onto theirs. The chef in the kitchen does major work - cooking and bringing everything out to the many people who order, good work!  We shared Nachos with Carne Asada ($9) which was pretty bomb, plus an order of Mac N' Cheese with Bacon ($8) which was no bueno. It was basically large elbow pasta with a watery cheese sauce and topped with nearly burned bacon bits. Sad face central. Stephanie S got the Bacon Wrapped Tater Tots aka Bac-o-Tots ($8 for five) which she said were yummy, but not a lot came in an order. Rita I had the Buffalo Wings in Island Flavor ($9), which were not particularly meaty, but had good flavor. During trivia we got all fat kid and ordered Tot-chos ($8) and they were OK, a combo of soggy and then dried out, I could probably live without them.  Anywho, I'd like to go back and try brunch. I think last night was also slightly tainted because there was a Wild Card A's v. Royals game on that went to the 12th inning, and there were way too many A's fans clogging up the joint. So that's that: I hope to be back, I hope no more awful men approach me and my friends, and I hope the staff continues to rock on.

vnV0eJVf0hb7MKu4tHCBJw.review_text: Wandered into the Boardroom by myself to catch some of the NCAA tournament. I'm from out of town so the bartender was very friendly since I was all by myself. I think his name was Lou... The place had a good atmosphere and a good group of people trying to get their Friday drink on.   The food was delicious!
