At the suggestion of the bartender I ordered the BLT with avocado and sweet potato fries. Delicious!! Everything tasted fresh. I wish I lived closer so I could visit this spot regularly.

u238Qh2YnnfL6qlvrmL7Tg.review_text: I couldn't agree with Jane A. more, you MUST try their bacon wrapped tots (given that your heart can take it).  On the drive home after a night of drinking & hunting with fellow yelpers, I couldn't help but think that they were the most:  HEAVY GREASY ARTERY-CLOGGING DEATH-INVITE that I can't help but want to eat.   And I can't help but want more. :]

5k0AYioQAwUT3K-v7UQZxw.review_text: A place that serves pulled pork sandwiches and bacon wrapped tater tots is as good as it gets! I cannot stop talking about the tots. So amazing!   The service was also great. It's a good locals spot or place to stop by if in the neighborhood.

m0AFrRqCNBpCK26_vbxjVg.review_text: Visiting from Houston... first establishment ventured to after arriving in SF for new year celebrations with buds... and lucky us, it turned out to be Tuesday Trivia Night. After walking all the way from Powell St. BART station up to there, I was ready to get on with some relaxin'.   - Cool and chill ambiance (and apparently dog friendly as well - random creatures running around your feet while standing around)  - Ridiculously cheap and amazing tacos (due to the special salsa?, or grease?, or maybe made more amazing after the tiring walk / day of flight? who knows, but afterwards I was craving them all week long)  - Fun and diverse crowd.   Only complaints:  - the bartenders kind of struck me as douchey, but they kept people entertained and seemed to be on top of 'it'  - everything outside the tacos seemed to be relatively overpriced  - witness oregon beating oklahoma state (i hate the pac10) before the 'trivia night' part started   All in all, seemed to be a nice neighborhood bar and if I lived in the area, I could see myself hanging out there every now and then.

PrqhlhGVjq5FuaM9pW6Enw.review_text: Soon as we opened the door we were greeted by Carrie - the bartender's dog!  After the sniffing and petting stopped we grabbed a couple stools and ordered our drinks!  The drinks were good, the bartender was very cool, the music was VERY loud and the clientele were friendly.  Actually over friendly and too drunk would be used to describe the wasted couple that stumbled in and sat down I mean, fell down next to us.  the guy spilled his drink down my side which totally pissed me off and I let him know by jamming my elbow into his side and told him to "scoot the fuck over."  They continued to serve drinks to them and they continued to get sloppier.    When I heard my husband say "i'm going to knock him out" after the guy stumbled into me AGAIN, I knew it was time to go.  Last thing I need on a Saturday night is a bar fight in SF, right?  Regardless of the two a*holes we had a really good time.  I'd go back!

kJburVO8dCgZtFRULVkfeA.review_text: Went to the boardroom with some friends last Sunday morning, because I heard they had a decent brunch and a bloody Mary that could "knock my socks off".  Both had exceeded my expectations. I had the loco moco with house made gravy, which put me directly in heaven, and the side of bacon smothered in maple syrup.  Can I just say, I will return for the bacon alone! if there is a heaven, I sincerely hope it is made of this bacon! Moving on...      The service.  This place was packed,  wall to wall, and the bartender (can't remember her name, but girl with brown hair) was on point. I didn't have to wait more than a minute for my drink,  which considering she was the only bartender,  I was impressed. The bloody Mary won me over. Now,  I usually hate bloody Maries,  but I was peer pressured into it, and I am very happy I was! I've tried others since, but meh... Not the same.       In conclusion, I'm now a fan of the boardroom. They said they have trivia on Tuesdays, so I'll have to come back for that! Believe that I will review that night too!

4dclJLG4cO_ACx2zkCbjag.review_text: The Tuesday Taco Trivia nights are awesome. The chicken and steak tacos are both really good, more like street tacos than anything I've had in a long time. The fish tacos are the best though -- they're $3 instead of $2 but soo good. They ran out of $2 beers this past Tuesday but I guess it doesn't hurt to not drink Tecate or Tiger for one Tuesday. Get something classy, like Budweiser. The pub quiz is really fun too except that I never know anything except for the questions about pop culture and children's books. The quiz will start late if there are good sports on (like the NBA finals). Expect to stand if you don't get here early enough because the place is really small -- I'm always jealous of the people who get the plush couches in the corner. Plus Keith, the bartender, is super nice. They're lenient on the $20 minimum for credit cards too which is nice for people like me who never make it to the ATM before these things.

4H6fXlz4rOHRa1vPOFqRdQ.review_text: Great place to have some drinks while the wife is out shopping. Came here with a buddy had a good time drinking while we watched the Raiders lose another game :(

RVKadMPQnfWj7CxyX_gaGQ.review_text: very few places in SF a local can go to on a Friday not and not get annoyed.  Boardroom is one of them.  GREAT bartenders. local crowd.  looks like it might be a great place to catch the games.  two thumbs up.

-Db9qbIoQ3X2-dqYu01oSg.review_text: the boardroom very quickly became my favorite sports bar in sf. the drinks are cheap, the food is above average, and, most importantly, the staff is amazingly friendly.  in my book, only kezar pub bests the boardroom in the sf wings department, so give those a try, but not before you devour a plate of bacon-wrapped tater tots...what a genius idea.

s3XmVL8UT5duKjPaQp43cg.review_text: Woody Zips is a cool little neighborhood bar; definitely a nice spot to relax with some of your buddies, a beer, and watch the game. The two guys who recently set this place up are nice, and didn't hesitate to give my friend and I some free shots on a slow night. In the several times that I have been there, its small space has been pretty packed... A good sign that business is doing well. It may seem to attract a large number of marina-types, but this can be easily tolerable when in a good mood.  Overall a comfortable, small neighborhood bar that certainly warrants stopping in for a drink while journeying through North Beach.

ghost_id_1.review_text: I just got home from trivia at the Boardroom. Not the best trivia night I've ever been to, but the f-ing $2 tacos were incredible, and the cheap Olympias and Pabsts were not too shabby, neither.

xpRAjmgL-pIcIY_9iOpcQw.review_text: My new favorite bar in North Beach.  I used to come in wayyy back in the day when it was Shannon's to watch 'gator football.  Think I might have tried it's "Woody Zips" incarnation once, but just never became a fan...it was just so clean compared to the utter sh*hole that Shannon's had been that I couldn't adapt. Plus they moved the bar from the lefthand wall to the righthand side which tripped me out.  But then I stumbled in a few Fridays back (okay I walked in...but there might have been a slight stumble upon departure), and it was packed, and I mean packed with...wait for it...,no, not hot women...I know what you guys were thinking...but dogs. Gorgeous, playful puppies.    I'm so jealous because they are all just lying there on the couch and I *know* I can't bring my baby here because even at almost four and literally the best trained dog I've encountered in SF he's a little energetic.  Just a little bit.  Seriously, remember back when drugs were cool and people had money and did blow?  Sonny's like that ALL THE TIME.  (That's a lie, he's a Labrador so he sleeps 18 hours a day, but the 6 that he's up he's MOVING).  So this Saturday rolls around and its a beautiful day and I feel a need to get outside.  Sonny and I stroll over to meet a lady friend of mine at Washington Square Park.  We're there like 10 minutes or so when she says "You know there's NCAA basketball on right now?"  My heart melted a little.  Seriously...that's like hearing a woman say "My hot bisexual roommate wanted to know if she could join us?"  So knowing that the Boardroom is dog friendly and has at least 5 flatscreens, I decide to see if Sonny can play nice with mellow dogs.  We walk in and there's another lab, Maya, (whom I'd met before) there and the two of them get along famously, even though she's one hot bitch and Sonny still has his balls.   It was a minor pain in the ass because Sonny's favorite room in the bar is naturally the kitchen, so I have to keep one eye on him, which leaves the remaining eye split between the game, the girl who wanted to go watch the game, and our order of tater tots.  That's right...tater tots.  The 5th food group.  With two dipping sauces, one of which was cheese.  For like $2.  Also, while I didn't partake I did notice that on weekends they offer bottomless mimosas with their brunch menu.  $12...not a bad deal.  To recap:  1. sitting in a bar with my dog 2. getting buzzed on a Saturday afternoon 3. watching Elite Eight basketball 4. with a hot girl who's idea it was to watch the basketball  5. eating tater tots  Whoever called Disneyland the happiest place on earth never tried the Boardroom with that quint-fecta goin' on.

JuxQgUdH6DO4moCEhwbFbA.review_text: Great place! What up Sal and jen!

Aln7oGojGguFtYLmGtkSrQ.review_text: Went to the Boardroom for the 2nd time this past Tuesday.... great bartender / forgot his name / great $2 tacos, $2 Tecates, fun rounds of trivia (we sucked), and a bunch of really friendly patrons - exactly what I want in a (slightly divey) neighborhood bar.

TwhTe_WBiWaArKELqjumEg.review_text: Made a quick visit this weekend for the first time to catch a bit of the UNC-Nova game.  Cool sports bar vibe going on... they've got multiple flatscreens so you've got a clear view no matter where you're sitting.  Grabbed a guiness, bartender was really quick!  Was pretty full in there, but wasn't too hard to grab a seat.  Apparently they recently started serving fried chicken and waffles.  I didn't try it, but my friend's buddy ordered it, and yeah - it looked awesome. Fried chicken and waffles and a beer? Nice.

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: It amazes me how I keep meaning to go to places that I hear about for some sort of yelper-posted event for another, end up flaking at that time, and then end up at said place totally randomly.  The Boardroom was the second stop on the "date" (and it was getting less so by this point, although seemed more so due to the switch to porter), and I'm glad I finally checked it out.  We headed over here to watch some NCAA basketball (my choice, I'm a bossy bitch) and there were plenty of t.v.s on which to watch the games...even though it seemed the channels kept switching.    Although we didn't order any food, we managed to score some free fries which were much needed at that point.  They seem to have an excellent liquor selection, although I stuck with beer which ended up being really cheap.  Yet another bar where a cute pup wanders around, which makes it almost 5 stars for me.    I really must come back for trivia night, and hopefully this time I'll answer some questions correctly...the other night I didn't.  Meh, I've experienced better (the date, not the bar).

8ExCZVowOo3LK2QG6G8Xmg.review_text: Have been here a few times, as my friends used to live close to the bar. There are a few smaller TVs scattered around the bar, so it's good for watching sports (but there is limited standing room so not so good if you are in an odd corner which requires you to crank your neck to see the screen).  The owners and bartenders seem to have a good relationship with the regulars so I must admit that if you aren't one, you may feel like an outsider (and the find the staff a bit annoying/pretentious). On one occasion, I sat down at the bar, which was practically empty since it was around 5PM and the female bartender took a while to acknowledge me, and when she finally did, I asked her what was on tap, and she expected me to know... On another occasion, I was here for trivia night, and the MC can be quite rude/obnoxious, but I guess others think she's funny ?  Have tried a few of the menu options, including the nachos, wings, and tater tots, including the bacon wrapped tots. Everything is pretty standard but I must admit, their plain tater tots are the best I've ever had -- for that reason alone, I would come back!

EaH156ksdjyTnuyXo67bRg.review_text: Great local neighborhood sports bar. Great attitude from all the "help". Love watching Thursday night NFL games there - never over-crowded and the food is actually pretty good for bar grub. Totally recommend this place over most of the other "sports bars" in the City.

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: THE BURGER (3 stars)  So, I've been to The Boardroom and had their tator tots there and they were delicious. I was happy to see them participate at the Ft. Mason Burger Brawl but was kind of disappointed in the food. The tator tots were not what I recall. Their burger looked pretty plain but something about the patty was pretty tasty, what killed it though... the bread - it was dry as hell.   Will I be back? I'd skip them next time at the Burger Brawl and would rather to go their bar to eat.

ws6VBKkh6RhZH1afgAtFqA.review_text: holy crap, the bacon wrapped tots were simply amazing!  worth it to come here just for them!

3ZrjvKpBvez2uHzvDNxa_g.review_text: Through a combination of setting, food, music, patrons and bartenders, Boardroom earns every star of this review.  The bar itself is nicely appointed, feels clean, and while North Beach isn't my usual stomping grounds I like that it's close to lots of other stuff - at one point I walked around the block to pick up some cannoli.  The menu is solid and served till a decent hour - I had a couple of the fried chicken sliders and I was fucking glad of it.  The music last night was great, there was good company and my bartender handled shit properly - had my first absinthe drink and loved it, strangely enough.  Now for the blah-blah-yelp-reviews-are-full-of-pointless-­personal-stories section:  I came here last night for the anti-valentines day party put on by the lovely Berna T., and I gotta say...it was a classy group of people.  I had a good, relaxing time, even if the event made me terribly sad and being in groups of people just reminds me that every man is an island unto himself.    Melodrama aside, I see why people love this place.

2wJEU5pwBFeDFLd-5y3X2g.review_text: This place was definitely cooler than I expected. Cruised in here Friday night because a friend said he knew the bartender. We proceeded to sit at the bar and booze it up. The drinks were perfectly made. The crowd happy, friendly, and a little wacky. Except for the way too drunk popped collar chode who was upset that Paris had to go back to jail. That was too much for me to resist. I HAD to bite. We ended up having a loud roaring debate on whether Paris Hilton was a victim of her celebrity. Almost sends me into a rage just writing it... Obviously the crowd was on my side and we only made the PH lover cry a little bit. :-)

XaMwHlRaUfsSjBewVAbiQw.review_text: Dem tots. Dem crispy, bacon-wrapped tots.   When you see a sign that says "bacon-wrapped tater tots," you're bound to come in to see what the fuss is all about. The Boardroom certainly gets some points for having this unique item on the menu, but what really sold it for me was the neighborhood vibe. THIS is what you'd call a corner bar!   The bartender seemed to know a lot of the regulars around there. He's even a bit of a gambling man, stating that my PBR would be on the house if I guessed the number and suit on my bottlecap. I may not have been so lucky (it was the seven of diamonds), but it just gives me all the more reason to come back and try my luck again.

FnVgTYt6f1ZqLPS0QanFHg.review_text: This place is such a great find.  We didn't want to wait a year for breakfast and thought our options would be slim but then we found this place!  Between the service, the awesome rescue dog that wanders around getting love, and the excellent breakfast I will definitely be back!  I had the breakfast BLT which was sooo good.  Bartender gave us a sample of the Bloody Mary mix which was also amazing.

7rjAgnw-DsHThvzf6TDBLQ.review_text: I live across the street, and in the two weeks since moving here (SF) I find myself coming to Woody Zips with increasing regularity. The beers are cheap, its not obnoxiously packed (as in, screw it I don't want to force my way through a crowd to get to the bar packed) and its definitely more upscale then you usual sports bar (the artwork is a nice touch, a bit of class but without overdoing it by using real artwork, I think a Monet print would be a touch gauche here).  On a side note: I came to SF for the first time for Fourth of July this year and stayed with a friend down the street. One of his former roommates is friends with Luke, the owner, so we watched the fireworks from the roof of Woody Zips, which was pretty damn awesome. Had some beers and food at Lukes apt as well (though I would totally not expect him to recognize me, he was basically letting us use his apartment with its roof top access, he was out of the apartment and at the bar 90% of the time, and there were lots of people there). So yeah, good peoples and cold beverages

Em_P1RN5imjbgHDBXMuF3w.review_text: We came in to try out Yat's PoBoys, but sadly it is no longer available. So we decided to at least try out the Bacon Wrapped Tater Tots and have a drink. They were really really yummy. The Sunday was a nice gentlemen and really east to talk to. I will definitely be back when I'm in the hood.

EHwNw8KOy8PbkCz46mdhhA.review_text: I have only been for Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday -  a great trivia night.  Great beer prices (for SF North Beach) and cheap tacos (2$) on Tuesday nights while playing trivia.  Small place, can get a bit cramped, and the food is nothing special- typical bar food, but the bartenders are great- friendly and quick.  I don't know about the other 6 nights a week.

OCcHlcwqFtHcKFo5t4UBYA.review_text: I love this bar! And here is why:  - the atmosphere, because it's neighborhood friendly and everyone talks to each other. It's still in North Beach but you're less likely to get into fights with hoodrats stumbling drunk out of the clubs. - trivia nights because the whomever has the best team name wins champagne. And also the questions aren't too hard... love it when they have the questions about movies and clips of it they show on the screen. Almost too easy for me! - food deals up the wazzooo... cheap and delicious! 50 cent wings on Mondays, and their tacos on Tuesdays are quite delicious.  - almost always having Mirror Pond on tap - their decor is quite lovely. They don't call it The Boardroom for nothing. - great place to watch games. Everyone gets into it! - they have great bartenders. Especially Ben, whom is very witty and charming and is always up for some conversation.  Long story short, it's an all around cool bar to be at. You all should go!

XvKdp9PB4rKJKwI798mJgg.review_text: We were able to get a table and it was comfortable and big. I got a beer and tried a couple of a friend's fries and they were yummy! I've heard this place has better than average food.  Lots of TVs too...

wVpwTZ0ynSgHWn_tgzx2vg.review_text: I am now a regular at the Boardroom's taco Tuesday Trivia night, and currently a member of this week's reigning champion team, "I Went to Vegas to Steal My Shit Back and All I got was this Lousy Conviction."  WoooHooo!  The Boardroom's trivia is definitely not a walk in the park.  5 rounds encompass current events, images, music, movies, and then one specialty round (in the past this has included Russian History, spelling, etc.).  The fish tacos are delectable.    Drinks are cheap until 7 and trivia begins at 8:30.    Also a bottle of champagne is awarded to the team with the most clever / funny name.  "No Means Yes Means Anal" has won two weeks in a row with probably the most tasteless name ever.  Watch out.  Pull that again and we're going to name ourselves "No Means Yes Means Fisting," if that's what the judges will consider FUNNY.

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: Stop #4 on the crawl... The Boardroom is pretty small and not great for big groups, but the weak had dropped out so the 10 or so of us remaining grabbed a booth in the corner and the stools lining the entry way. They have a pretty full bar and a few beers on tap. The bartender wasn't mean, although he could have been friendlier, but I guess he made my drink and it was fine so who am I to complain? They have lots of TVs which is nice, and the crowd was pretty low key. It's slightly off the tourist path so everyone there seemed to be local. I even ran into some old friends.  Just a note that their credit card minimum is $15 so bring cash.

DZ1wz524vtPNMgYrOaFygw.review_text: Friendly crowd. Awesome bartenders. What more can you ask for??? Oh yes I know. Taco trivia Tuesdays !! I think I have a sick obsession for trivia. You get 2 dollar tacos that injects your brain with magical powers to answer these asinine trivia questions. It's so much fun when you get play with a full house. Sometimes I wonder if these people just sit there and read stupid current events all day. OVERALL...I LOVE IT!! Alcohol + tacos + trivia = PURE HAPPYNESS

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: ASU bar!! GO devils. Its pretty small but a good local joint.

j45PuQ1uZeljOh4vCmwi3w.review_text: This place is like cheers, the guy always remembers your name.  Edit: Let me clarify. I'm not freaking kidding about this OK!?!?!  If you go to this bar and tell the owner your name over your first beer, he will remember when you come in 1 month later, and he'll remember your favorite drink, and your great aunt sally's birthday. It would be a great way to look like a player if the place weren't such a dive, as it stands it's a great way to look like an alcoholic.  Favorite bar in my neighborhood.

9g-O4F_pJMPv5RkByEZNUw.review_text: My wife and I were in town during college football season and were looking for a place that both served food and had our Oregon Ducks on.  We searched around Yelp and found this place by chance. It doesnt look like much from the outside, but glad we decided to go in.   The owner is an Oregon alumn and showed up just after kickoff. He was really friendly and sat down with us and rooted the team on.   The lunch was very good, good size portions and good quality ingredients. The tots were amazing. The breakfast food looked equally as good when it was coming out just before kickoff.   The Boardroom gets 5 stars for the friendly people (fans and employees alike) and being a good value for such a small hole in the wall bar.

MQL7RSeMrcmPdqf7ilF3zw.review_text: Great food and drinks!! Bar tender is fun and very generous!  You might even get a firebomb on the house if you're cool!  Best place to watch the Redskins game! Order their Moscow Mule and their Loco Moco.  Yummm!!!

TMWgq3KNRDaESXs8ZCrRtA.review_text: I came here for a breast cancer fundraiser for my friend who was guest bartending.  All the drinks are reasonably priced and they have really good bar food.    The owner was there and super friendly.  He was helpful about what drinks to order/food to order (AMAZING TACOS).  There are darts in the back.  The bathroom is pretty clean.    I'm sure I'll be there again!

z-SilTRtybLa0nYZoNbgMg.review_text: Have you ever had one of those drunken evenings when you got into a deep debate regarding what the definition of a Cougar is?  Well I have, and it just so happened at Woody Zips.  Now there wasn't a Cougar to be found, but it was a great place to poll the bar.  Low and behold we found a pretty even tie on what a Cougar was, it was great having so many people willing to jump at their chance to put their word on as to what a Cougar was.    Now on to the Bar, beer a little spendy at $5 a beer, but that is not what stood out at this bar.   HOT WINGS!!!!!  Wow I don't know what to say, the best damn wings I have had, only rivaled by a few, their wings were perfectly cooked, with amazing sauce.  So overall, good atmosphere, good people, awesome wings, and a good all around neighborhood bar.  Cheers!

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: I find myself having to update my Boardroom review yet again, because Keith and his crew have been dishing up new ways to keep people coming back.    So, maybe it is partially due to the fun (albeit overly crowded) Tuesday Night Trivia & $2 Tacos, or the $1 well drinks on Sunday nights, or the $5 Chicken & Waffles Special, the cheesy tater tots, or the fired up crowds that come in for major sporting events (flatscreens, what what!).  Or maybe it's all the awesome bartenders: Con  (who puts up with a lot of shit from a certain ball-busting ex-Yelper), Jen (hottie girl bartender), Casey (dances behind the bar), Brandy (love the tats!) or Martin (most intimidating looking teddy bear) and my favorite door dude, Danny...they will remember you and treat you well if you aren't a complete asshole.  Or maybe it's because it has an extremely low douchebag quotient considering the locale.  Oh wait, I know why I love this place.  NOW SERVING...........................................­.......KARAOKE!!!!  And no worries, I will *absolutely* let you have the mic!   . . . . . . . . When you tear it from my cold, dead hands.   (Or Danny's.)

iY41hl-J7Nw32spi0BalUg.review_text: Was visiting San Fran for the weekend and ended up following a few guys there after Columbus Cafe ( another cools spot). They suggested we check this place out and a friend and I followed. :)  The people there were awesome and everybody looked like they just wanted to have a good time. Glad I joined! :) Oh yea and the tater tots went awesome with my beer.. Cheers!

BmadK3z9p31Ua3MYsZQyyg.review_text: Went here because someone that I share a workspace with said they have good wings and other bar food.  Luckily went on the wings special night and had several tasting items from the bar menu.  Really liked the onion rings, nachos and wings while the bacon wrapped tater tots didn't quite live up to billing.  The bartender Sal was really fantastic - nice guy mellow great serving.  This place is everything you want from a local bar hang-out (not fancy)- I've already been back with my wife and she loved it as well.

ksRdqPxR-of7gpnAD8JrZA.review_text: I just started working down the street and love all the bars in north beach but there's something extra special visiting a local bar with awesome food!! -- Every Mon, killer happy hour with something like 25cents each wing and they aren't some lame hooter wings there absolutely gourmet! I like my stuff spicy but he'll make them any way you'd like!!! LOVE the owner Keith, if anything stop by and say hi!! Everyone that works there is great!

oVgFYN37V-hr1BEas-Rd8Q.review_text: This place gets 5 stars just for its Tuesday trivia night. I'm not even that into trivia, but I always enjoy it here. The atmosphere is chill--no frills, but it's a clean, cozy place. Food always entices me, and their tacos are surprisingly out of this world for a sports bar! $2 for chicken, but I recommend the $3 fish--it's covered in a savory sauce that beats Mijita's fish tacos in the Ferry Building. The only problem is it's not that big, so it gets crowded on trivia night.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Great local bar.  The tots wrapped in bacon are overrated.  The mac and cheese is awesome.  I need ot try the burger next time.  I'll b back

RhOMDvLhQG62l6hhcgtiPg.review_text: My time I spent here was pretty mediocre, but it wasn't the bar's fault. It is a locals bar, and that's nice since I live in the area, and have had my fill of tourists at day's end. The problem being that North Beach locals and I don't have similar tastes at all. See, I am a person that will actually gravitate more toward the divey bar than the posh one.  So, naturally I was excited by people's reviews saying it was a dive bar. When I arrived, I was reminded of why I don't fit in in North Beach. This place is NOT a dive bar, it's a cross between a neighborhood bar in a strip mall in Orange County (if those exist there) and a sports bar. People also claim it's laid back, so I wore a nice t shirt and jeans, and felt shabby in comparison. This was a Thursday night, and it seemed to be on fire when we arrived, about midway through, the crowd was just one group and split. I thought Thursday was the new Friday?  So, most of the minus points are just because it wasn't my type of atmosphere, and because of the 90s corny lite rock/pop playlist. And a huge minus for the guy that turned the music off completely, then yelled for everyone to "be quiet and listen for a cellphone." Buzzkilling douche! Plus points were having Afflingem on tap (with correct glassware), 2 dogs chasing each other across the place, and a nice bartender without 'tender 'tude.

yfG8hiLv0mA0ltTNXERuYQ.review_text: I don't live in San Francisco but every time I go this place is a must. Walking here for a good drink after having dinner, or even ordering food there (really good) while watching every game that's on and having nice chats with a bartender is what you can expect.

e1IsFbb9rlL6XWshsPIlvw.review_text: Went here for my friend's b'day and had a great time. Good vibes, nice seats, and a great selection of drinks. This is a really good bar.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: The Boardroom is my FAVORITE bar in San Francisco. And that is saying A LOT because San Francisco has so many amazing bars! Here are a few of the many reasons why:  - $2 Tecates and $6 for a Tecate and a shot = a great, easy deal - Amazing special cocktails (if you know what to ask for...!) - Great food: love the breakfast tacos and sweet potato fries especially!  AND... - This is the bar where everyone knows my name! Yes, CHEERS! :)

4UL3DMIbD75c9xLXYB-Saw.review_text: I was across the street at North Star and my friends wanted to get food at this place. They ordered the tator tots and I eneded up eating last one of them. They have bacon wrapped tots that are good. Of course I met Keith and Casey, what a duo. They are super friendly, way friendlier than North Star bartenders. Service was slow though, Casey was talking with some people at the other end of the bar forever and Mama needs a drink. :)  Good times, trivia night was last night, but I met up with other friends as Kozy Kar so I missed it. It was pretty packed.

DLu1gmytH0WSt3LdniwaBQ.review_text: Fun fun fun !!! Just ignore the drunk guy who walks around asking everyone if they want to fight and he will eventually leave you alone. Cool crowd and cheap drinks. Great place to watch a game.

CqVM1P-jjY7wy52K6gEqow.review_text: To the guy below that call the place "Racist". I was there and I'm african-american. You were kicked out for taking your beer outside. No place allows that if they can't serve liquor outside. The Bartender ( Sal ) was super polite, reasonable and gave you NUMEROUS WARNINGS. You and your friends were out of line and rude. You can't break the rules and be sh*tty!!!! Sorry... you gotta Pick One! That is why you got the Deuces, bruh!  This place is amazing. Great Food and Great Staff. The perfect local sports bar!!!!! From the drinks specials to the neighborhood, it doesn't get much better than this. It's kind of place you can walk in alone and leave with new friends. Love y'all!!!

0qvijl9gnUNKZ4YilSlsqA.review_text: If nothing else, I love this place for the tater tots. There is nothing like a bloody mary and an order of tater tots and waffles to cure a hangover on New Year's Day. The bartender was awesome. We thought we would have to order from the bar, but he came out and took care of us. He was rowdy, as am I, and he makes the bloody mary's spicy. It is a great brunch/day-drinking spot, but I'm not sure if I would go there to drink at night. It started to fill up with football fans in the early afternoon, and took on a more Marina vibe. I got hit on by a guy that was 6 years younger than me and it made me feel like a cougar, but I am just a puma.

h0FPJR1jCDpwq0C4t8ArLA.review_text: On weekend mornings when you can't stand the thought of dragging yourself into a pair of heels and curling your hair for brunch, there is The Boardroom.  A divey, welcoming establishment where the weekend brunch-time bartender takes pride in entertaining his patrons. It's like having brunch at a friend's house - aside from getting a check at the end.  The bloody mary is divine and garnished with a house-pickled green been (yum), $14 pitchers of mimosas are just what some weekends call for, and the irish coffee is so, so lovely.  The breakfast BLT is crispy and buttery and pretty much everything your poor pounding head needs. Also tasty is the breakfast burrito (with sausage) and bacon wrapped tots are a classic.  I'm not a fan of sweet food for breakfast, but the biscoff french toast looks amaze as well.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: After reading all of the great reviews about this place I decided, with a little prompting from my roommate, to see what it was all about. Up to this point I was a little hesitant. I remember when this place was Shannons and I wasnt sure someone could turn that dump into something desireable,   The new owners have done a good job of giving this place a facelift. Completely gutted the place and started over and it is now a somewhat upscale looking sports bar, complete with 4 TVs and local artists work hanging on the walls.  Everyone was friendly. We went on a Monday night and had their fried chicken special ($12 for chicken, some really good mac and cheese and a side of veggies). They were even willing to give us 1.5 orders of it since the three of us each wanted to split an order with one another.  The beer prices seemed a lttle high ($5 a beer) for being off the beaten path a bit. For a bar that is working on being a neighborhood bar rather than a tourist haven they should really think about dropping the prices just a bit.  Overall a pretty cool neighborhood place. I am curious to see how it evolves.  3/9/07 - Update - after spending another evening at Northstar I realized this place deserves an extra star...I forgot how god awful some of the places in good ol' NB can be.  3/17/10 - Update - this bar is no longer Woody Zips (clearly) and I have been back several times since it has changed hands again and become the Boardroom. Some of the food items have changed, but they are all still good, possibly even better, and they have added bottomless mimosas on the weekends so I see there are even further improvements!!

zpb17M4OG4Agjn3dK32CEw.review_text: Nothing boring about the Boardroom on a Tuesday Night!   Almost a 2.5 week long binge on partying and socializing has left me running on empty (both via the bank account and my energy levels) but I wanted to check out this North Beach spot due to all the hype.   I'm so glad I managed to get here. There are so many reasons to trek all the way up from the TL.   1. Its off of Broadway so I'm fairly confident that it won't get packed on a Friday or Sat.  2. Accepts credit cards ($20 min.)  3. Real cool/fast/attentive bartenders who are easy going and know the regulars well.  4. Totally reminds me of my regular watering hole (Whiskey Thieves).  5. Happy Hour: $2 tacos, $2 beers, $3 Chicken Sliders, $6 Jager/Olompia special. They also have tater tots and fries. Overall, a great bar food selection.  6. THE BEST TRIVIA NIGHT I HAVE BEEN TO. I have been to trivia night at 3 previous bars and this trivia had the most diverse set of questions which allows everyone to participate. Now if they only had a round of flip cup, that would be just peachy. We won second place for the best team name. Woot.   Can't wait to come back for those tots.   ps. To the cute girl I met that night: See I didn't throw up on you, hit me up some time....

ARZEF-3LkCLJVSrW9BtHOw.review_text: This place is fairly new and isn't the most glamorous place on the block, but I like it for one main reason: The people. I have met a few or maybe all of the owners/bartenders and they are all great. Plus the crowd is actually really cool as well. I learned about this place on a pub crawl in North Beach a few months ago and I really enjoy going back. Another place I found on the crawl, was the Northstar which happens to be right across the street from woody zips. Both of the Bars are a lot of fun and have a really good crowd.

m5ssxEA0FTwYpGKi646Rjg.review_text: I was drawn to this place with the promise of bacon wrapped tater tots and brunch.  I understood this is a dive bar, so I didn't expect too much. The food is cheap bar fare. There are lots of tvs showing sports and lots of frat alumni for those that enjoy those things.  The fact their cocktails lacked essential ingredients, however, is the reason I'm giving this bar a low rating.  I ordered an irish coffee that didn't have any whipped cream on top and a pisco sour that didn't have any egg whites in it. I can excuse a poorly made cocktail in a dive bar, but an incorrectly made one is where I have to draw the line.   BONUS TIP: For good cocktails nearby, check out Tony Nic's Cafe or 15 Romolo.

M4x7LkzUqKoRNlV42uFo7A.review_text: not a bad little spot in north beach. kitchen was already closed by the time we had got there so we weren't able to ordered the fabled bacon tater tots

Zgvf7jcSRZfoNZP-1KHj9g.review_text: Solid place with a great staff.  Try the Shrimp Po Boy. Great place for a meal or a game.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: Just another run of the mill AWESOME bar.  Excellent bartender, clean, good prices, lots of televisions and great bar food.  This place just makes you feel comfortable.

J5MJGJr939qH0XfBqEC81A.review_text: I like this place, but I'm not in love. I usually end up here because Northstar is too crowded.   I will say that the bartenders are friendly. Their pours are generous and even more generous during Happy Hour. Luke is my favorite.The bar food is awesome. The chips and salsa (chips are deep fried), the burger (is huge) and the sweet potato fries are insane! My favorite thing about this place is that they serve corn dogs. Yes I've tried them and no I prob won't eat them again. However, they serve corn dogs and they serve a variety! They have your traditional dog, a lamb dog and a turkey dog. Use your imagination.  So they serve corn dogs and they have my poison of choice: Absolut Ruby Red. Honestly, what more could you want?

Ktusi9_epT45A30y0GhHhA.review_text: Please go and get the corn dogs - they are delish. Also, possibly one of the top 5 for wings in the city.   We were in there on a sunday and it was empty and relaxing but I can definitely see going back for a game.  Thanks Keith!

nCYcZqc1S2q-8_NvL2Lrww.review_text: Great spot!  Truth be told, I've generally been frequenting the bars with freshly squeezed juice kind of cocktails.  Must say though, they rock the cocktails here despite not squeezing the pineapples and cranberries onsite.  Welcoming vibe, good drinks, great prices.  Fun bartender who clearly loves what he is doing.  I will be back!  Didn't see any sign of food menus, however, so not sure about any of that, but again.... I will be back!

ww0UBHkI-XJ9_1oIdv6Uyw.review_text: Friendly service. Great food (bacon wrapped tators,! Deep fried pork buns with awesome sweet and spicy sauce!). Great drinks! Non pretentious patrons that will sing along to Whitney Houston and do push ups for shoes! What more can you ask for?

VvQM7ULlGGm8c3W2oCNZdA.review_text: Cheap drinks, friendly staff, fun atmosphere, clean bathroom, patrons choose the music. I'm adding this to my list of dive bars to revisit on the weekends!

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: I had forgotten that the 750 Restaurant no longer serves brunch so a quick look at my Yelp bookmarks in the area saved the day.  The Boardroom no longer offers bottomless mimosas but you should order the Bloody Mary anyway.  Martin quickly became one of my favorite bartenders after bragging about his mix, rightfully so too!  It complemented my bangin' Brisket Breakfast (poached eggs, brisket and potatoes swimming in au jus) quite nicely.

d2Xa7nTMzPoGWDRyr2QinA.review_text: Settled, home-y vibe. The drinks are decently priced and they carry at least one off-beat beer, which is refreshing. The furniture was kind of awkwardly arranged.   Seems like there's usually a bouncer outside, though they're not that serious about IDs.

2XKA9NwN499NjkePsWS8BA.review_text: They've got a great trivia night on Tuesdays and some of the friendliest bartenders I've met.

lfm5HbzSgj6Y8o28Fd89UQ.review_text: great food, excellent bloody marys and they have been really accommodating to our CLEMSON TIGERS on gamedays. martin is the man.

7-3hVAMj42uAyc3oiVIlQA.review_text: A great neighborhood find.  They have really, really good wings (vinegary like I like 'em) and tacos.  Pretty crowded Friday night 9pm-ish but not like I wanted to tear my hair out of my scalp.   They don't know how to make a snakebite (cider + lager; they used cider + Guinness, which is a black velvet).  The 'tender was a bit arrogant and gave us attitude about it, but kinda goes with the joint.

ujTAcGkASwNNgku8BWPOzQ.review_text: Came here while the $6 fernet + tecate or fireball + tecate deals were advertised.  Decided I had to finally try fernet, as I am a San Francisco native and it would only be appropriate to say I have drank it.    Suffice to say that those deals have changed my drinking choices forever.    Fernet & Fireball 4 Evr.  Also, they have a dart board in the back, and that is good fun with a small group of friends.  Chill place, friendly bartenders, friendly crowd.  A+ would drink again.

QPhKwoNEGYzIeidIOh-5gQ.review_text: After a very bad experience at Elephant and Castle's trivia night about a year ago, I've been searching for another Trivia place for awhile. The Boardroom is PERFECT!  We showed up on Tuesday at 6 and they put the debate on their three big flat screen tvs. We all ordered tacos ($2) and Olympia ($2) and were very pleased with the beef, chicken, and fish tacos. They even made a vegetarian taco for my veggie friend!  After the debate ended the bar started to get really crowded. Everyone was showing up for Trivia Night. My team, The Answer is Five, was tied for first place up until the spelling round where we got destroyed...sad :(  I will definitely be coming back and I'm already recruiting spellers for next week. The trivia was great. They did a music round with clips of songs and a movie round with video played on the tvs. They had a name that person, picture round and then a few round of random information ranging from Current Events to Sports to Pop Culture.   The bar isn't that big but it's very nice inside. They have chairs along the wall, a couple tables in the corner and a couch and some comfy chairs near the back. They also have a second bathroom in the "storage closet" in case you really need to go.  I'm really glad I checked this place out. Their sign is black and red and not inviting but now that I know what it's like inside, I'm planning to spend a lot of time there.   They also do Bingo night on Wednesdays!

3uLnxiRIhSBFhefhywauuQ.review_text: I ordered a vodka soda and was served vodka with flat soda and a lime. There are really only two liquid ingredients to this drink! Moreover, it is so standard that any bar that is practicing the business of making drinks needs to get it right. It was like drinking vodka mixed with water.  My boyfriend, who claims to love Boadroom in a four-star-kind-of-way, ordered a beer. When I finished forcing down the gross vodka soda I asked him to order me the same beer that he had. He said, "Uh, I do not think you want this beer." It was a beer, what could be wrong with it? Warm and flat. I learned that the hard way.  I was completely underwhelmed in a neighborhood with so many bars. We had some snacks which were fine--typical deep fried bar food. The crowd was eclectically entertaining. That is why Boardroom does not get one star. There are surfing photos and snowboard bindings mounted to the walls as decor.

m-_pnRtoqOxw-zOtDADckQ.review_text: Went there last night for Taco Tequila Tuesday Trivia.  Loved the trivia, best MC I've experienced in SF.  My friend had a chicken taco and loved it.  I had the veggie burger and tator tots with BBQ sauce, exactly what I wanted, total soul food for me.    Had to skip the tequila, but when I asked for heavy on the vodka wells drinks, I got them, not as strong as Bellingham, WA wells drinks, but hey they were selling $2 Oly. Seriously, I haven't seen Olympia anywhere since I left WA.  Oly is kind of as bad as Rainier (Rain-ier beer comes from here . . . - you're definetely from the Seattle area if you have any idea what I'm talking about.).   The manager/owner (?) was great (minus eating big nasty steak with his hands in front of me, but props for noticing I thought it was gross and moving on) and his (?) dog was adorable.  Other bartender was nice too, but didn't make as strong a drink, he clearly needs to visit Bellingham or Olympia.

Hc_VXq8EG3W_WxHRhvZMUg.review_text: Decent kinda-sportsy bar. This is good place to go on a Sunday to catch the game with a fun crowd and there's a dartroom or some fraternity-closet-looking room in the back.   + 4 or 5 midsized TVs playing all the football games + cheap, borderline free drinks (cocktails, beers on tap, PBRs if you're feeling ironic) + decent selection of food  - TVs are small - seating can be scarce, mainly because of bros on bros on bros.  - quality of food is hit or miss (the tater tots tasted unusual)  Worth checking out if you're in the area, don't make a trip out of it though.

4FXbovgSEFZ5_9S5wddFIg.review_text: Try the bacon wrapped tater tots!  I am not sure they are '$9 good' but it is bacon and tater tots, you really can't go wrong.  The Boardroom was a typical dive, order at the bar and disgusting bathrooms, but it was fabulous to get away from all the tourists!!  We each had a cold beer, wolfed down some bacon wrapped tots, then decided it was time to move onto the next watering hole.

TV1o8G-Pvk0NYt5taaeuiw.review_text: After eating several entrees of food and enjoying a couple drinks, my friends and I were outside chatting with some other guests and my girlfriend brought me a beer while I was outside. She claimed that the bartender was cool with this. While we were outside talking, a man who claimed to be the owner happened to be walking into the bar at the same time. He stated that we could not have our drinks outside, to which we gladly obliged and brought our beverages inside. At this point the owner seemed very upset with the bartender for letting this happen. Once inside, my girlfriend went back outside to have a smoke and did not have any drinks with her. She had been outside for about 20 min and since the area is a little dark and shady, I decided to peek my head out the front door to check on her. Let me clarify, I did not set foot outside of the door I only looked outside to make sure my girlfriend was OK. At this point, the bartender very rudely asked me to give him my drink. I believe he was trying to make up for his prior mistake of letting us take the drinks outside and to look good in front of the owner. Once again, I did not put up a fight and gave him my drink and the bartender never mentioned that I was cut off or could not have another drink. About 5 minutes later, my buddy had an extra drink, which he gave to me. When the bartender saw me with another drink he proceeded to officially kick me and my whole group of friends out of the bar. My other friends asked why they were being kicked out as well and the owner claimed "Because you are with him and I have to backup my bartender". My friends were from outside of the area and I felt we were being treated unjustly and unfairly because we were seen as outsiders. Message to the bartender: own up to your mistakes and don't try and make up for it by being overly strict to customers, that is not a fair way to treat your business.  tl;dr: I had a terrible experience at this bar. Even though our entire group was being respectful, and under control we were told to leave. Mind you, the bartender had already received his payment for our $80 tab, which included food and drinks, when he decided to kick us out. Which I'm sure had something to do with the ease in which he kicked us out.

Z2AuC5sWT4mjPgt2ga7S0Q.review_text: Nice. Kind of off the Beaten North Beach path is the Board Room.  The only time I find myself in North Beach is late at night grabbing a late bite to eat if I'm feeling something Italian.  The Board Room is a pretty cool spot  that made me feel comfortable to be the only black male in the spot  I was a little self conscious at first but after my first martini that was really  good I was cool.  I even got some props for rockin my Naruto beanie.  The Board Room is a clean little spot even though I made a mess with my tasty chicken sliders.  The spicy  sauce and jalepenos made it one for the ages!  I kind of wish I would have stuck around for a bit a had the chicken nachos but I had places to be.   I'm kind of glad I went for the Anti-Valentine's Day party  that Berna La Glam hosted. I didn't meet her but I'm sure I met a few other yelpers that were having a good time but I didn't anounce myself as a yelper.  I don't want to feel like I'm apart of some kind of cult lol.   I did kind of fancy the girl in the red top and red heels she was like 6 drink a head of me. The one thing that made me reflect about anti valentines day is how much I miss my party girl and best friend. I really wish it could have worked out in my favor...  No more  sob stories

tcRhKVs9Tr6-7ohP3TIeaA.review_text: Taco Tuesday is off the hook. Try the carnitas tacos. And you can never go wrong with bacon wrapped tots

0dDl29T0H_AGMIXGlB_wXg.review_text: This place is as good as it gets when it comes to bars. We were heading from Fisherman's Wharf back to our hotel in Union Square around 5:30 and noticed a dog inside. My wife and her friend stopped to pet the dog and we wound up having a few rounds of drinks, enjoying talking to the patrons and bartender. Everyone was extremely nice, they had an above average selection of beers on tap, and they had good happy hour deals. They also have a jukebox smartphone App that my wife was obsessed with (you can download the app and pick songs to be played for the entire bar). I had written off the entire city of San Francisco as a tourist trap until we found this place. I was really happy to search for it on Yelp and find that it is well received. The Boardroom is definitely a place I would go to all the time if I lived in SF.

aXuxyyTDs5RGoFrhajPLYg.review_text: Needed a place for food and mimosas since we were super hungry after a successful night out.  So...bacon-wrapped tater tots?  SIGN ME UP THEN PLZ.  Surprisingly very good for a weekend brunch, especially given the dive bar nature of the place.    Surprisingly though, a very good brunch.  I would've never thought that a beef brisket with poached eggs to be so good at a place like this.  But they said the beef just came in that day, and it was fresh as hell.  Gave it a shot...man I was not disappointed.  That brisket was flavored very well, and the broth was quite tasty.  Must also mention how friendly our bartender was, made our stay that much more enjoyable!  Definitely worth coming back here for sure.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Decided to give this place a try after our visit to Northstar across the street.  It was still early on Friday around 4-5pm and it seems they are still cleaning and getting ready.    It's a bit dark with a lot of surfing items as decor.  The owner was behind the bar and he was surprised I spotted him as the owner.  Anyway, we decided to try the wings ($5 Happy Hour price).  It took quite a while but it was pretty tasty - there were 5 wings to the order.  Seem like people really like this place for their Tuesday trivia night and $2 taco, not really as their neighborhood water hole.

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: I really liked this bar, not just because we won on trivia night.  Go team, So Ronrey!  The trivia was really fun.  I always prefer playing when the questions are made up by the quizmaster, rather than the canned ones that I know some people cheat at.  The questions were asked at a good pace, and they didn't take forever to score the answers.  While we played, we had 4 or 5 pitchers of Blue Moon, the steak nachos, tater tots, sweet potato fries, tacos, grilled cheese and onion rings.  Everything was decent but the nachos, tacos and sweet potato fries were the favorites.  Our total at the end of the night was really reasonable, and the bartenders were smartasses, just like I like them.  We'll be back.

2GnEiGnw968a-h-v52mSSg.review_text: A couple reasons why this place is great:   1) I took a girl here once and she HATED it. That's now I knew it was good. So I kicked that bitch to the curb.   2) The bartender is a cool ass dude. This is weird that I have to even say this because I feel like one of the prerequisites of being a bartender should be "don't be a dick", but we all know how that usually goes.   3) I like mimosas.   4) The brunch was awesome as hell. I haven't had anything bad from the brunch menu. You also got to have respect for a place where the guy cooking your food, brings it to you. So you know he wouldn't dare bring you something shitty because he has to look you in the eye.   5) I got to piss off everyone with my musical selections on the "juke box"

qrxpcs4HOhMAID2LufTT9Q.review_text: Blue Balls on Black Friday need Pink Taco!  Best team name = Free Bottle of Champage!   Apparently we are flawed (gasp!).  I had come to think our trivia team was unconquerable...but this past week we didn't walk away with the $30 bar tab we've come to expect week after winning week. Good thing we still have something going for us...creativity :)  As reigning champions for the last 4 weeks at Tuesday Trivia, our streak came to an end.  We fell short by only 3 points, but came through with the best team name of the week! Holla playas! Free bottle of champagne works!  FOOD- Yes I go to the Boardroom on Tuesdays for more than just trivia, free bar tabs, and champagne...Tacos!  $2 for Chicken/Steak and $3 for Fish. Yum. All of them yum. Not quite Nick's, but close. Chicken Sliders- $3. Super tasty and not remotely good for your health. Pretty good calamari, and the steak nachos and quesadilla are delish, esp the nachos. Sweet potato fries seem to be a hit/miss. Rest assured the tacos are always the bomb.  Keith and Con are fantastic. Treat them well and they'll hook you up.  See ya Tuesday when we'll once again regain our status as reigning champs and take all you mo fo's down...again.

tvzvnNkafpTNI5yCaGW46g.review_text: Good eats, good company, a little out of the way so you don't get so much of the marina overflow.

J1aurUGR360LS7GRnuW5PA.review_text: Cool bar.  The bartender is great here.  They also sell food here.  Check their chalk board for specials that they have during the week.  This bar is really close to me but I prefer the bar across the way only because I go to a bar for drinking and entertainment, not for the food.    Don't get me wrong, this bar is cool, but I do like free billiards and more TVs to watch certain games.  Thas all....

YitXopfcsZUS7rbOWotvdA.review_text: How can you not love Boardroom? The drinks are great and always on a special... the food is fantastic. If you have never experienced their sliders, you are missing out! I was introduced to this place well over a year ago and will continue to frequent whenever I am around. Make sure you try their bloody mary! Nothing but the best things to say!

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: I was pleasantly surprised by the Boardroom:  good drinks, nice bartenders, cozy place with a decent amount of space (and seats). I got introduced to the Boardroom when I went on a pub crawl that stopped there.  From the name, i thought it was going to be a stuffy place (as in the business version of a board room), but when i got there i found that it was named was pleasantly surprised to learn that it's the surfboard kind of boardroom.  I've only ever been for drinks, but it's a chill, laid-back place to have drinks with friends.

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: $6 for Tecate and a shot of fernet isn't a bad deal, but the bacon-wrapped tots is somewhat pricey for what (little) you get.  You'd be much better off ordering the chicken tenders - they'd be more filling at least, for about the same price.  They are very salty though, so be prepared to order more beer to wash it down with.  It's a vicious cycle!  The bartenders are great though.  I second what Alison B. said that they treat you like a regular even when it's your first time there (or your second time within the same day).

EOMN4mnbGO8j4Mze7HIcFg.review_text: I'm all about Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday. The host is a fantastic lady, and they seem to put a lot of effort and thought into it. Decent beer selection, and fun times for all!

gytFjzBw-z5LZD-6JSMChg.review_text: Pretty good spot ... North Beach is not my fave ... and the crowd at most places out there can be so so but this place was not too bad.   My drinks were poured a little on the weak side (I like to order tall drinks cuz I drink so fast) the bartender/I think owner actually MEASURED my shot of whiskey! :(  .. it seemed like he measured even less than a three count. Anyway, the trivia night was pretty fun and the food looked good.  I'll probly be back if I'm lookin for somethin to do on a Tuesday...  Next time I'll go hungry :) and order beer PBR's :)

yv2UlWzXy6buGLwyoyNkNw.review_text: Went into Woody Zips twice this weekend. Well once if you want to be technical...First time started with great beer, decent crowd, and friendly bouncers/bartenders.   Cut to mid way through the day, come back with a bigger crowd. It's St. Patties day I know the place is packed we must wait in line, no biggie. The ass at the door lets half of my group in, it's obvious btw that we're all together in a group. Then puts his hand out to stop me, "How  many in your group?'  I reply, "Um we're with them." My friend comes back and  wants to know why only half the group got in. I make what I thought was a humorous crack and say "Apparently our kind are not welcome in there."..Comment not taken well. He flips out and then proceeds to tell me how I am not welcome in his establishment, my kind won't be tolerated and that I am  rude. WOW!!!!!!! Here is the funny thing, I was pretty sober at this point and I'm only five feet tall, not some brooding drunk giant. Do I appear to be the bar brawling type? How do you 86 someone that can bearly see over the bar??!!?? lol  I'm saddened I feel like this bar had serious potential. I will never set foot in there again "as my kind are not tolerated."  ***UPDATE: So I have yet to go back to this bar, but I'm going to update my review anyhow. After reading my not-so-nice review, I was contacted by both owners. AWESOME! Yelp justice at it's finest. They both apologized and I believe I have a beer with my name on it  next time I visit. It's nice to know that the owners care about their bar and the patrons. Thanks guys! ;)

D01KrKs9izEdoT0Eh4i4rQ.review_text: I've been to the Boardroom a few times now and I've enjoyed it every single time.  The food is pretty decent, reasonably priced, and you get a lot of it.    On Sunday's they have Bottomless Mimosa's for $12 and I think they have $2 Tecate's all the time.  They also have NFL games on Sunday's during the season.  Since it's an Oregon Ducks and ASU Sun Devil's bar, they have games from those schools on too.  The bartender's are nice and the service is great, even when there are lots of people there.  For a neighborhood bar, this place is difficult to beat.

y3HFVx8nbNmomSc-PWOy-g.review_text: Popped in here recently and like I said last time, Sal totally rocks!!!  Great little bar...across from the North Star and away from all the general craziness.

Rnfozp5HL7OTR6rbaDg64Q.review_text: As charming and friendly the bartender was, as much as I tried to like this place, The Boardroom is not recommended for breakfast.   The breakfast foods are average at best. Major complaints at my table were the dry biscuits and too many salty beans in the breakfast burritos.  However we did really like the $14 pitchers of mimosas.

wsDiT-IGGM8tvlaMwf1zwQ.review_text: This place is for turds. I'm sorry - it had to be said.   The Boardroom is dirty and not in a rustic dive bar way. More like a "I just walked into someone's living room and they haven't picked up their shit off the floor in months" way. It is also like a living room in that all the bros (and woman bros) at this bar seem to know each other and they all have to grunt loudly at each other and yell across the room before taking a sip of their drink.  Drinks are normal and not cheap. The food was practically inedible. Being here made me want to die. I'm not an asshole, I promise.  One star for being close to my house?

oBgYDUYPl2yI_fD-cB_nIA.review_text: Mission: Taco Tuesday Venue 3  We were the first in the bar at 6pm... great for us because we didn't have to wait to order beers or Tacos. $2 chicken and steak tacos were pretty delicious... especially liked the soft shell that was slightly fried. We discovered that they do $2 tacos all the time, leading us to ponder perhaps a Taco Thursday? But I digress...  Started with Blue Moon on tap, then had a Tiger Beer (yay Asia!), then devolved to bottles of PBR. Seems like the drink of choice for most others that night was the $2 Olys though.  Spent between 6 and 8:30pm getting a good buzz on and chatting up the bartender (Shout Out Keith!).  Trivia started around 9 and, well, we sucked. But it was a blast and we were thoroughly happy when we left at 11:15. Next time our team name will be: Drinking our way to last place. (Oh, and it wasn't overly crowded... maybe we picked an off night.)  Only Con: Between two smaller ladies, each having 2 tacos and then a shared round of $5 happy-hour-special nachos, we still managed to rack up a tab of more than $50. Eeks. Oh well.

9hQvIXgZU1eq7B-0jWfkkw.review_text: Pretty good and unassuming spot in my neighborhood. Mostly local crowd and decent selection of drinks, including some interesting tequilas and one of my favorite gins - Miller's. Still haven't been to Tuesday $2 tacos + trivia night, so might have to check that out. The only thing I can reasonably complain about are the bar stools - they are pretty damn heavy and unwieldy to sit in.

e7RkJGYr5Yg0iZoGdUhyMQ.review_text: Caroling pub crawl was well received.  Bartender was great and crowd was awesome.  Order the pitchers of mimosa.  Highly recommend.

eiTboCTfpX0t8mWXLwcwYQ.review_text: Great bar, awesome bartenders, cheap chicken wings and bacon wrapped tator tots...plenty of tv's to watch sports.  Bar is full of 49er faithfuls...

1d-sMlYqOkrfPPh_6VePrg.review_text: You know those great local bars in your neighborhood or your friend's neighborhood that you always have fun at and would come back at the drop of the hat? The boardroom is that kind of spot. I have same I'm somewhat biased because this is the unofficial ASU bar and as a proud alum here in San Fran its not always easy to find.   Tuesday night is really fun too, cheap tacos and $2 beer. One of my favorite places to come and watch a basketball or football game and relax. Food and drinks are both great and def not expensive compared to the other places in the neighborhood. There's even a parking garage literally next door that makes it really easy if you're travelling by car. Highly recommended!

u6ms8jCUMd3qhlB6hufV-w.review_text: Ladies and Gentlemen, the great Tuesday debate has been solved! No longer do we have to debate Taco Tuesday v. Trivia Night, because Boardroom gives you both!  They've got cheap, greasy tacos, which is all good because their grease tastes gooooood. The nachos are also spectacular, and you can get an Olympia (or four) for $2 a pop.   Trivia is entertaining and with a wide range of topics. Stick around after your dinner, and get ready for some drinking and thinking!

B2jNEZXPcieDWgWhYtg0kA.review_text: Oh the days I used to stay in SF and WoodyZips was a stonesthrow away... I really miss this place and the deconstructed CORN DOGS! anyone who can serve up 3 amazing corndogs for $8 is automatically amazing...  and I guess I should also mention the awesome bartenders and the friendly people who love to kick it at this establishment too!

0aEsYrwrBHE4LRgvv-A2yg.review_text: I have, from Woody Zips to Boardroom, always been impressed with this divey little locals haven.  TVs, games, blaring iPod music (that you CAN ask to have turned down if it's really bothering you), swell staff, and pretty awesome burgers (and food in general).    I've only visited on afternoons, so can't really say anything for the crazy (or lack thereof) nights.  But all in all, I would say it's a great alternative to other similar joints in the neighborhood.

mpFLXU5Hc8pDlxZpbfjFNQ.review_text: The boardroom instantly became one of my favorite North Beach bars, but how could I resist~ the good food, the cheap beer, the nicest bartenders ever, the well played music selection, the trivia. I really didn't think it could possibly get better, but magically it did- they added Wednesday night BINGO!! I have to say I was a little skeptical at first, but the free drink prizes along with post dance parties I haven't missed a single week.  BINGO Wednesdays can't be missed!

qDZON_eIlgEG6XZUrk9-lw.review_text: Wine was pricier than I anticipated ($8 for a house red). But it's a cute bar with friendly staff and a relaxed atmosphere. Good for people looking for a comfortable spot to have a drink and a snack.

0t-O5--DOfS55A620fO_GA.review_text: Yay! I'm a fan.  Here are 5 reasons why I give two thumbs up to The Boardroom:  1.  The Boardroom is an Arizona State University bar! Fork 'em, Devils! The NorCal ASU alums congregate here for games 2.  Bacon-wrapped tater tots are amazing 3.  This little dive bar is cozy and has a great neighborhood feel!  4.  You can get poutine here!  5.  The regulars are friendly and the management is too!  There is good company here

aohGpwDqs7Rsy6qlZ5h4YA.review_text: Maybe I am just in a giving mood today as my reviews seem to be glowing but this one really deserves it. WE were looking for a place that my friend could watch the game and we finally landed mainly due to Yelpers on this place. The fact they had bacon wrapped tater tots was simply deep fried icing on the cake. When we go there we were surprised at how small it was but they indeed had several screens on and one of them was the game my friend wanted to watch. We of course wanted to dine so the extremely cool and helpful bartender (Martin) got us fixed up with menus.  The selections were not your typical bar food, my friend had a veggie burger with sweet potato fires, I can vouch for the fries as I stole a few (for review purposes of course). I ordered the signature bacon wrapped tots, and a breakfast burrito that took up the entire plate. It was very tasty and really not too overwhelming for its shear mass, but had what I have to assume was house made guac, and other goodies. I also had their secret sweet tea vodka concoction which I have to admit would be dangerous if consumed too fast or if you had to be somewhere serious but in the context of brunch it was just right. So I had 2.   I guess the biggest plus for this place was it was clearly a neighborhood pub, and we were clearly not from the area but I felt they treated us as if we were there every night, I think anybody can sling drinks but Martin made us feel like he was opening his home and making sure we got whatever we needed. And he had great taste in music which never hurts.  If you are looking for a great brunch and what I assume is a great place when the sun goes down to enjoys some drinks head on over to The Boardroom.

M0mONsg1ZJIKA30ad1qE1w.review_text: bacon wrapped tator tots.  in theory, it sounds awesome, they were actually overcooked, dry and quite salty.  i do appreciate they give you a mix of buffalo hot sauce and ranch to dip it in, but for $8, it's a little steep considering there were about 12 tots on the plate

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: Tasty bar fare (sweet potato fries), cheap drinks, couch, extremely friendly owner, nice bartenders and a kick ass Tuesday trivia night.

duymKKwUruH8GwbvcaFd0w.review_text: Nothing distinctly special or wrong about this spot, but I think I'll have to go back on a Tuesday to check out their special for the fish tacos.  The good thing is that it's not tourist filled and more a locals joint.  Of course I was there on a Monday and the only one there for a bit.  Luckily the bartender was nice and attentive so she definitely is solid.

4OrFB2TDRsbokoYMhUf1EA.review_text: 5 stars for some of them bacon wrapped tater tots also known as the BAC-O-TOTS of course also for our bartender  driving in the north beach area with some friends, on the window we happened to see Bacon wrapped tater tots, of course we found parking and had to venture in hahaha.  the spot itself is not that big, they do have alot to offer on tap, hard liquor and their choices for food are on point, there are several happy hour specials so you won't break your wallet coming here.  sampled one of there pilsners off tap, it was lil in-between the hoppiness and bitterness were muted since it was ice cold, refreshing and perfect for the palate of some of there bar food. hahaha  we sampled their Bac-o-tot simply genius haha tater tot i believe fried with a slice of bacon wrapped around it. enough for 3 folks to have if another choice of appetizer is offered in our case buffalo wings. The buffalo wings were standard glazed with some tabasco not to much just rite amount with ranch on the side with few celery sticks and carrot sticks  about 4 tv's that I could see 3 playing the WS Championship Giants playing and one playing motorcross, definitely a place you should venture into when in the area  food ***** for the BAC-O-TOTS hell yes price $ happy hour M-F service ***** ambiance ***** small, lil divey, friendly staff, bartender is a trip haha!!   also music in the background was mellow, sounds of Benny and the Jets playing, Lowrider and other nostalgic music.

3xXCE8znoAN2MulweWgwtg.review_text: Great local spot.  They have something going on every day of the week and always have a decent game on 1 of the 4 flat panel tv's.  Taco/Trivia Tuesday is a must do, the steak taco's are BOMB.  They have a foosball table most of the time so it s a great place to get your foos on if it's not too crowded.    Overall its one of my favorite North Beach hangouts.

_NSNcam96fXaA3aZohaKkQ.review_text: Came here for the Supaaabowl with the boyfriend.   1) Parking a bitch 2) There is no number 2.  Had a drink, a laugh, and got to watch the Puppy Bowl for a few minutes before the actual football game started. Let's be honest, watching dogs is much more entertaining than watching the Giants win.   The bartender was really cool to tell my boyfriend and I that the small nachos were more than enough for the both us. Usually I'll let my stomach do the talking, but after a shot or 2 and a beer, I'll go with what he said. UGH SO GOOD. Thank you, barkeep for the suggestion. I don't think we even finished it.

7kmlaGMjjCHN8rL8oncz_A.review_text: i had a blast, a friendly neighborhood bar, can and does get popular, so be ready, and taco trivia tuesday is super! gonna take my girl here!

fx_oas0OGcUWsAF_jOCx0Q.review_text: Good Selection of beers, good bar food and cool bartenders. Good place to catch a game.

zGOXKICJ-X6tcoIHaGaITg.review_text: Loooooove Martin! He's a great guy, super funny, and always has a great story. We stopped in after brunch at Don Pisto's on a sunday and  had a few rounds. Super chill place, great menu, happy hour M-F. They show all games and if you're lucky Maya the doggie will be around. . .

RlCJggBXxFpt2xuOWkKDvg.review_text: A Sunday morning my friend and I were standing in a 2-plus hour line for a well-known restaurant with high reviews and eventually we tired of waiting and I decided to use my yelp app to look for less-crowded places near by. Luckily for us, The Boardroom was what we picked. I was a bit apprehensive of eating in a bar at 11am when I wanted some really great breakfast food, but most on yelp said it was to be trusted so we went for it. I am sooo glad I did. What first got me in there was the bacon-wrapped tater tots-they did not disappoint (except for the fact that I wanted more after we finished the basket. Don't share-get your own!). I have never had anything like them and I will be drooling at the thought of them for quite a while-at least until I get my hands on a deep fryer and perfect the recipe. After our appetizer we ordered the cookie dough stuffed French toast and the Croque madame-both were delicious. Then, as if we hadn't splurged enough, we decided to go for the pitcher of mimosa. During the time it took us to get our buzz on I played around with the really cool app that lets you pick the music in the bar from your smartphone.  The food gets an A+ and so does the service. Marvin made us feel super comfortable and welcome from the moment we walked in and gave us excellent advice on menu items, city tips and picker-uppers to help with a food coma. I also thought it was pretty cool that they served Pisco and Fernet-things I had been missing ever since my visit to Chile that have been pretty hard for me to come by in the US. Plus, they make their own alcohol infused whipped cream-delish! Every time I make my way up to Nor Cal I will definitely make sure this is one of my stops.

btHv7yBw1Q77e25Bub_vPA.review_text: Nice place! Very nice staff and super comfortable and chill feeling for an easy Sunday lunch. Must try their bacon tots while rooting for your team on tv. Their drink selection is nice too so take a snap at it.

BLmRIoETvx6ZiegiIWh0tw.review_text: Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday  When I heard of this aptly titled trivia night at The Boardroom, I knew I would have to check it out for the aliteration alone.  I arrived at 7:30 on Tuesday night with three co-workers for trivia and bonding time with new employees. Upon entering, our new art director ordered a round of Jager bombs, a variety of salty deep fried foods a round of beers to follow. Yeah, it was that kind of Tuesday night.  We got a great table in the corner an the crowd slowly but surely began to gather as it neared 8:30. We had our exceptional Jager bombs and though they don't have a large selection of beers on tap, they a great selection behind the bar. Our food soon arrived and we devoured deliciously flavorful shrimp tacos, corn dogs with a fabulous cornmeal batter and something as sinister, and fabulous as bacon wrapped tater tots. We were all fat kids last night.  The night progressed with more jager and tequila shots to go around. We didn't win trivia night and came to the conclusion that we need a geography wiz and someone well versed in bad movies.   As a whole, the bathroom is pretty clean, the bartenders are friendly and the space is small but cozy. It's just the right size crowd for this type of event and it turned out to be a fantastic evening out. I will surely go again once we brush up on our bad movies.

rL1rSdS08VW1SURkgzD_ig.review_text: Any place that serves bacon wrapped tater tots gets at least 3 stars. The Boardroom is a place that everyone was raving about, so when I visited San Fran, I had to check it out. I wasn't disappointed. Along with the slamming tots, the wings they served were also freaking slamming. I wasn't a huge fan of the quesadillas, but I think it was because they were filled with black beans and other veggies that I don't like. Whatever. The other food made up for it.   The bartender was freaking awesome and knew his stuff about beer and good music. So that's always a plus. I wanna check this place out during a football weekend, because i heard it's crazy fun to watch sports at this bar. I guess it's just another excuse for coming back to San Francisco. Good work Boardroom. Boom!

tYtzhCCqQdmIxspXRsNXOQ.review_text: 5 Stars alone for being an ASU bar.  GO DEVILS!  Great burgers and solid Sunday brunch as well.

bLbSNkLggFnqwNNzzq-Ijw.review_text: Came here with the BF and his sister when I got a hankering for some burgers- this place came up and was nearby, so off we went. Was told upfront that it was a bar that serves food rather than a burger place, specifically. Good thing too, because when we arrived there was only bar seating and we hesitated at first, thinking maybe we would not be able to eat here.  Luckily, we stayed- probably because the game was on and we didn't want to waste time finding a new spot, but the fact that wings were on special really helped, too.  Fifty cent wings on Mondays, 5pm-10pm.  We ordered a round of beers (had the hawaiian one on draft- can't remember the name, but it was light and sweet, refreshing) and a ton of food: a burger and the brisket dip to share, with sides of bac-o-tots and onion rings, plus (what amounted to) 25 wings in spicy bbq, hot, and spicy island. More on those in a minute.  Burger was just okay, dip sandwich was dry and tough and we did not finish it- very unusual for us. Bac o tots were awesome, but seemed overrated based on other reviews we read here. Onion rings were okay.  The WINGS are where it's at though- specifically the SPICY ISLAND. I could bathe myself in that sauce. It was phenomenal- I was expecting something with pineapple that's overly sweet and not usually my thing, but this one.. dude, I can't even figure out what was in it! A fresh green herb/spice was present, possibly basil? Or maybe thai basil? Overall the taste to me was more thai than island, but whatever the hell you want to call it, we ordered extras of it, and even then I was dipping my pieces in the extra sauce puddled at the bottom of our basket.  Service was good- bartender/server clearly enjoys his job and was making conversation with most at the bar. Made good food/drink recommendations. Space itself is divey, and that's okay- all the TVs were working and the food was good, so that's all that matters.  Definitely want to add that the unisex bathroom was surprisingly VERY clean, which I almost didn't expect based on the looks of this place- but the appearance is deceiving. Most dive bars have mediocre foods and questionable cleanliness- and you'll find the exact opposite here: phenomenal island wings and tidy space, from the bathroom to the bartop.

-g3MZ5auviJ89FbU6pD0Fg.review_text: Can you say Hipster special..... PBR and a shot of Jamie for $7 any night of the week.... I say yes please. The regulars are good people, but you do get the occasional douche bag coming in already from another bar. The bartenders are great....

Hnu5s_myOZZIS2eny7liVA.review_text: Post-Awesome 80s 5K (yelp.com/biz/awesome-80s…), we arrived in North Beach a bit early for our brunch reservation at Trattoria Contadina (yelp.com/biz/trattoria-c…). After parking, I quickly searched "bloody marys" on my yelp app and this place popped up.
