There just so happened to be four stools available at the bar and the bartender whipped up some delicious, perfect-amount-of-spice, bloody marys. We almost canceled our brunch reservation elsewhere when we spotted some of the delicious food offerings being served around us. I'm glad we didn't because our brunch at Trattoria Contadina was incredible. However, I am bookmarking this place for another visit so we can try the food. Mostly because...tater tots!

6M9vEozgZy-uTXVKr-zXvw.review_text: Bacon wrapped tator tots !!! Surf movies and a great atmosphere  I love the boardroom

gZV7Ps9eVunuUY1E9qjj4w.review_text: A great neighborhood bar whose bartenders are always nice. Surprisingly the food is good too, a much needed item when I find that my Happy Hour has run longer into the night than planned! And who can really complain about a bar that has Fernet specials!!!

rV8jGAyZI2k9tzs4dPSk2g.review_text: $3 Fish Tacos on Tuesday.  That alone should make you come.  The shells are a perfect mix between soft and hard, and the other ingrediants as fresh as they come.  The sweet potato fries were decent too--a little soggy, but they had that great earthy and sweet taste.  The bartenders are wonderful, just like Theron says.  If you're into a fruit punch, refreshing, slightly alcoholic girly drink, ask for the Kerry Berry.  It's named after one of the 'tenders puppy dogs, and it was a great compliment to the sweet potato fries.  Guys, it's pink, so you might want to get your gal pal to order it for you.  If you're going on Tuesday--get there before 7 or you won't get a seat for trivia fun.  This is a small, friendly neighborhood place.  We'd never been there before but they treated us as if we were regulars.  With food and service like that, we just might become just that!

-ty5eC5N6uWkEAt-j-E6SQ.review_text: It's hard for me to give a North Beach "dive" bar higher than 3 stars since you automatically pay a premium to drink in the neighborhood. I think the bar should at least give you something "extra" for that premium. This bar doesn't do anything special as far as I could tell. Really it seemed like it was just full of drunk 25-35 yr old dudes trying to relive their early 20's or college days.  The two good things 1. Trumer on tap...2. I've been there for private parties/guest bartender nights when friends of mine were bartending. Bars that support local events are cool. I'd rather go to the happy hour at Columbus Cafe.  Stay Tru Boardroom.

AsJ5TxY87oSFcGxu5tuc9g.review_text: Cool bartender and a chill vibe in this neighborhood bar. Don't pass up the bacon wrapped tater tots. Truly an appetizer born from binge drinking.

JzDPb9rFVNHsMWqaCGWjHQ.review_text: Bacon wrapped tater-tots.  I could go on and on about the incredibly friendly service, the relaxed environment, the fair-to-good beer selection and the preponderance of televised sporting events.  I could tell you about the fairly good food, and the likelihood that when you randomly stumble into this bar while looking for somewhere after a midday Giants game to catch a beer, that no fewer than three regulars will direct you to the best place to have dinner nearby.  And it's likely that when you come back to San Francisco a year later on business, that three people from your office will demand you take them here because you haven't shut up about this place for the previous two weeks after you found out you were coming to SF.  But let's be honest, you stopped reading at bacon wrapped tater-tots and I bet you're on your way there already.

60iCXLkb9xqhe5cvEun0kg.review_text: Woody Zips is a glorious establishment filled with a delightful assortment of fine spirits and beers.  The bartenders are friendly and knowledgable.  Woody Zips serves one of the finest arrays of pub fare you'll find anywhere.  Woody Zips is an upscale sports bar that sits like a magnet to lure in the kind of folks you'd see roaming the financial district on any given weekday.  Woody Zips is not a "marina" bar.  Although well-groomed and well-dressed, the crowd here always seems to be much friendlier and less pretentious than stereotypical patrons from the neighboring neighborhood.  Woody Zips stocks Miller's Gin.  If you drink Gin, you know why this deserves its own paragraph.  Woody Zips is a bar that I really want to give a five star review.  ...I really, really, really do.  They're so very close.  Four and a half stars.  What's holding me back from the full five stars?  The hot wings.  They usually have the best hot wings in the entire world (seriously).  But only when the right chef is in the kitchen.  Otherwise they're just "really freaking good".  The hot sauce is consistently phenomenal.  So what's the difference?  Good question.  Glad you asked.  The answer is how long they're cooked.  My friends and I all agree: when they're cooked almost to the point of being crispy, they're the best!  The last couple of times we were there... undercooked.  So sad.

0gEDwhSUIWIBz23MbLYMig.review_text: I have yet to be thrown out of this bar, or kicked in the nuts whenever I show up.  That is saying a lot considering the abuse that is sure to follow me here and be unleashed on the bartenders.  I don't even know how to describe it.  You would have to see and experience it for yourself.  Rather than hate me and my friends, I actually think that maybe they like us.  That or they are poisoning our drinks and need us to come back to administer each new dose.  Really though, they have great happy hour specials.  They have combined taco tuesday and trivia tuesday.  They have a really good bar menu, with tots.  The clientele are for the most part cool, which can be hard to maintain when you are so close to North Beach.  They have cool surf photos on the wall and frequently play cool surf videos on the flat screen TVs.  Conn deserves the medal of honor.

iqOaVJRprVKcT50t9k5jnA.review_text: Do they still do the trivia night and the delicious tacos? If so, get on that.

vTbQZNz8FH4jcrni7Vkl1Q.review_text: The board room has that mystery ingredient which makes a normal bar awesome. Pretty sure its not the $2 Tecates, nor is it the new jukebox, it could be the food specials of which i tried the thursday pulled pork sandwich ($7), which comes with delicious sweet potato fries and sour cream but i dont think its it.  The awesomeness of this place comes from the folks running this place - when the bartender pulled out a sample of Imperial I switched my order, to Imperial, he informed me that it was a sample, so I got the Tecate. Later after attempting to get some vegan food at the loving hut and finding it closed we returned, got a sandwich and the bartender offered his lone imperial - which was just one demonstration of the awesome service we got at the board room, (definitely gets the venue stars).

J2W5pb0_300Gmy-W7gZz6w.review_text: Great neighborhood bar....staggering distance from home (!).  Have to try the bacon wrapped tater tots...but also good are the burgers, chicken tenders, and Sunday Brunch (w/mimosa pitchers for $14,  Cake Batter French toast, Hawaiian Loco Moco, and Croque Madame sandwiches).

ORxSz94hR0bSl1zS1LuuOw.review_text: ALL AROUND AMAZING!!!!!!!! I could go on a on about how great this bar is but instead, I am just going to insist that you go to the Boardroom because you are guaranteed a good time.   One of the main reason I go to Boardroom instead of the bar across the street is the friendliness/attentiveness of staff.   They also have a full bar, food is great (especially breakfast burrito, nachos, chicken tenders with buffallo sauce YUM, and sweet potatoe fries), great place to watch games.   I've never been for Trivia Night but seems to be pretty crowded.   I recommend their sister bar, Tope as well.   Cheers!

vvGHIcfCr2toX6Bts5W7ew.review_text: I'll give the bar itself 4 stars, but if I was rating the clientele, they'd get a big FAT 1 star. Talk about a Sausage Fest. And not the good kind of Sausage Fest, ladies! All the worst kind of douchey sausages that you could never want to meet. I truly hope that we had an off experience last night when we went to trivia because I feel sorry for the Boardroom staff if that is what their normal patrons are like. I'll probably only go back if I feel like it's a good night to get constantly harassed.  BUT the bar. The most important part of the review. The people working there are great. Nice people. But there were no waiters, so be prepared to go to the bar to order. The food, for the most part, was good bar food. Bacon wrapped tater tots: Delicious (though few in quantity. Not shareable, in my humble, bacon-loving opinion). Tacos: Yum Yum. Nachos: Great. Mac 'n Cheese: Not great. Just avoid it. They lured me with the promise of cheese and bacon and I felt duped! It was more watery than cheesy and even the bacon couldn't save the dish!  $5 margaritas were okay, but not strong at all. I had four and felt fine. I should have been buzzin' hard though; I am quite the lightweight. But they have $2 Tecates on Tuesday, which is a sweet deal, so you should definitely go for that.  The reason we went to The Boardroom, however, was to participate in Trivia Tuesday, which was disappointing, in my opinion. It started about a half hour late, which, in fairness, was due to the A's vs. Royals game going into extra innings, but it just got going too late for a work night, if you ask me. I couldn't hear the woman reading the questions. When she spoke at a good volume, she was kinda mumbling (drink much, lady?). And there were HUGE time gaps between rounds. I heard that it is usually better organized than that, but it was frustrating for me and my gal pals.  My general experience there probably warrants less than 4 stars, but I truly believe it was an off night based on what I've heard from others, the yumminess of the greasy food, and the quality of the service. Worth a shot, just beware of male patrons: they just may be nacho-stealing tards.

rsnnflVx_efoUU6U2u070g.review_text: It was our last day in San Fran, and we were all pretty bummed, we needed food in our bellies before the trip back to LA! My roomie found the Boardroom because we were craving bacon  walked in  totally welcomed by the Bartender (owner?) who was super awesome The Giants were playing the beer and food arrived and we had a great time! will def be returning next time i'm in SF!!! MORE BACON TATER TOTS!!! (on a side note: the eggs were a bit watery and had no taste but its ok because the tots made up for it!) Turned my frown upside down :)

Wdc_L1VlVDfqxtRArJHjfQ.review_text: Love love LOVE this place! Best bloody Mary's and breakfast! Great place to watch a game, super nice people

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: What a pleasant football Sunday we had because of the boardroom!  The TVs aren't the biggest, but there are enough of them all around this cozy bar to make every seat front row.   The bartender was very attentive, and never left us with a dry glass. The food was plentiful, basic and tasty. I strongly suggest the biscuits and gravy, but would not frown on the moco loco either. Their buffalo chicken tenders hit the spot for our second round, but the most impressive we're the nachos and the BACON WRAPPED TATER TOTS!  The crowd was excellent, a mix of all ages appropriate for a bar. There were pats, Vikings, skins, Seahawks, and of course 9'ers fans. Everyone had actress time cheering for their respective teams in this highly inclusive environment.   My only gripe is in regards to the pitcher of mimosas. The bottom line is that idea needs to be reworked in a way that is tastier. (Most likely a bit more OJ is in order)

Fk_AmsYGrjJAIbBnqYqLRg.review_text: The owner is friendly, the tacos are amazing and I hear they have bottomless mimosas on Sundays. This is a place you often see people taking shots. Pink stuff, Jager, etc. Good times here!

RFuMyqihKYlTKx8SNAjrVw.review_text: Hit this place up after the Super Bowl and it was thankfully quiet for at least a half an hour or so.  I enjoyed two Seagrams Sweet Tea Vodka on the rocks, watched one of my friends continue to get playfully intoxicated, and took a few choice looks at a super cute bartender.    Then...  About 15-20 bubbly 21-23 year olds busted into the joint, flashing their debit cards to buy a round of the $3.00 16oz Coors Lights for their parties of four and we, of the enlightened elite, simply had to bounce shortly thereafter.  Ah, to be young again...

HO_W1FyE32ZQray2ntZ7cw.review_text: Went for drinks and late night. Awesome late night menu until 1. Corn dogs are delicious. Bacon tots may sound good, no bueno. Great bartender/awesome service. And best of all, amazing music. Lots of hits!

HH4JSXA8OB4kHPv37fnfdA.review_text: The Boardroom is one of the more solid North Beach bars, with a terrific selection of beer and food.  I would have definitely given it a higher rating if it  weren't for a few things that I've noticed over the past two years.  The Good: 1) Solid Tuesday trivia night - a little long for my taste, but the questions are always pretty solid, and the $2 Tacos are amazing. 2) Terrific laid back atmosphere with the owners and bartenders dogs roaming the floor for scraps, and some good seating areas. 3) It's selection of both high end and cheap beer is amazing.  Anytime a bar serves Olympia and PBR you know you have a solid establishment. 4) By far the best bloody mary in all of North Beach 5) The bartenders and owners are super nice.  The Bad 1) The food has gone somewhat downhill.  They used to have amazing burgers and pretty good wings (I'm from Buffalo so I probably have higher wing standards than most), but since changing over to the Boardroom from Woody Zips, it hasn't been quite as good (they do serve a solid meatloaf sandwich though).  Still the last time I ordered a burger I was less than impressed.  It also seems as though the fries aren't as good as I once remembered.  In their defense I know that they've gone through a bunch of chefs over the past few months which would explain the downgrade.   2) When it's crowded the service can be a little on the slow side, and due to the layout of the bar it can be really difficult to get the bartenders attention (I realize this isn't the only place).  3) $20 credit card minimum can be annoying.

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: my new favorite trivia night spot. $2 tacos($3 for the delectable fish taco) and $2 olympias all night on tuesday's. great way to get your grub on, get fucked up, and have a fun night of trivia for cheap. trivia lasts for about 2 hours with several rounds. 1 round was a picture of mugshots(i cant believe i didnt get shia lebouf, wynona judd, and james brolin...), 1 round was a weird "clue" like game that involved big and small cum-stains(dont ask...), 1 round was 1 minute movie clips to see if you could gess the title, other rounds were simply questions with different themes.  the trivia host was super cool and cute and knew her shit. she had to yell out the questions all night because the mic was broken, but never a complaint. the bartenders were cool, even throwing out an old dude that kept yelling out answers. this place is right on the edge of north beach and a definite great spot. looks like we may be doing a few UYE's here so check the events page for tuesdays.

v0ANF5-KxIWBtQQB0PfI4w.review_text: Martin makes a mean cocktail and he gives great recommendations on their delicious menu.  We tried the brisket and poached eggs and the breakfast burrito.  Both were hearty.  The brisket was tender and the au jus mixed nicely with the poached eggs.  The breakfast burrito had black beans and each bight was a perfect balance of huevo and tortilla.  We washed it all down with some Sweet Tea and a bloody mary.

OFNFtTc48LmXNk_NeZe9dw.review_text: Lots of locals... when I have been it has been really cramped... but it is a good time to pass the time with friends... met some interesting people there too... I prefer locals hangouts and sometimes they aren't as easy to find in NB anymore... too many B&T people coming over...  On a personal note... this place was the beginning to an end... It just shows how I don't hold grudges... I could have easily have given them 1 star for the bad memories.. but it is not their fault I had too many libations and the rest is history.. LOL

582iTyqKkoHeBFPMJuQEJw.review_text: For all you Arizona State alumni that live in San Francisco The Boardroom offers up a really nice little bar for all the ASU football games.  Service: Excellent with one bartender and basic w/ another so that averages out to above average...like a B.    Booze: decent to shelf liquors at decent prices...small selection of drafts with nothing to write home about.  Grub: Don't know.  It's in North Beach which basically has about 14 restaurants per square foot (no exaggeration)...so I usually eat elsewhere.  However, I have witnessed their Tater Tots covered with melted cheese.  How can you fuck this up?  Therefore, the food must be about average if you feel like eating there and regretting later what you eat (read basically just like any average bar food).  Nuts and Bolts: They actually have really....really clean floors.  Recently, an earring may have been lost on the ground and our party searched the floor for it's whereabouts (to no avail) but I did remark to myself "Wow, these floors are like...pristine...even for a non-bar they'd be impressive."  The bathroom is spacious and as clean as you can expect.  The bar area is large and there is an abundant amount of stools to accommodate most of the patrons.   Intangibles: This is an ASU bar.  On a Saturday you can find that 90% of the TVs are tuned into the ASU game or games that will effect ASU.  So c'mon down if you're an alum!  If not, c'mon on down anyway because it is a decent bar!  Well don't come if you're from University of Arizona...  ...well that may be moot since chances are if you're an alum from U of A you probably are delivering pizzas on any given night so you're probably busy.

re6fN6eb3NTL7hKK-5CYUQ.review_text: I was so glad my friend Kassidy suggested this spot for a group night out because trivia night was hella fun. The bar is kind of small but it had a friendly and cozy vibe. It looked cleaner than most of the bars in North Beach.  I liked how some of the trivia questions had accompanying images that showed up on the tv screen. With those type of questions, you foil the cheating bastards who try to look up answers on Google through their dumbphones (unless they got Google Goggles to work...).  Plus sometimes, when you're quite buzzed, you need a visual to comprehend what the hell they are asking.  I also like how they had beer specials.  Thanks to genetics, I inherited  from my dad a liver that enables me to guzzle a sh!t ton of alcohol. It gets quite expensive on my pocket and on my bf's pocket. Another plus?  They carry my favorite beer: Blue Moon!  I definitely want to go back and try their cardiac arrest inducing treats!

gisZy0HKXvX4YMspboRmZQ.review_text: bacon wrapped tater tots. 6$ fernet and tecate special. i love fernet. i love tots. so far, a win in my book.  i happened to come on a tuesday, and they were having trivia night. place was exceedingly packed. get here at or around 730 if you want a seat.  i love tots. did i say that already?

63SQPROZ48xwGUb2LloFQA.review_text: I just got home from trivia at the Boardroom. Not the best trivia night I've ever been to, but the f-ing $2 tacos were incredible, and the cheap Olympias and Pabsts were not too shabby, neither.

U_I0xgmnp6b7Ce8iJRxLtQ.review_text: The Boardroom serves as the commemorative site of the launch of my new signature drink. Mandarin Vodka (Grey Goose l'orange preferrably) and soda. So I went to the nerd braggade that is known as Trivia Night and drank so many of said new orangie cocktails that I actually loved the fish taco's. I'm told that it is just fish sticks cut up but ah well, they sure made my tummy happy, and my body just a tad bit more sober.   Minus one star for being an ugly dive bar. Another off because their trivia consisted of New York Times articles and whatever the hell is happening in China. If that is trivia then tell me the name of the place I have to go to to use my expert knowledge of anything that is aired on E! Bravo MTV and Vh1. No this isn't a rant, I liked the place and had tons o fun. Thanks Anna K.!

tULQIaP91_L1-MNZkqWnOw.review_text: The Boardroom is an inviting, locals' hangout. Fun and friendly people on both sides of the bar, good beers and cocktails and well-priced, delicious food. A must-visit in North Beach!

_DNjOYnC3Jlk1JcMQHEOkA.review_text: Pretty simple.....great food, prices, vibe, bartender......and the only place to watch a 49er game!!!!! Home of the bacon wrapped tators :-)

UqOSpuFXffTisC1ahPbaWg.review_text: They definitely have bottomless mimosa's!  I didn't eat, but it looked like they had some breakfast burrtio's and such.  They also had brugers and tacos - so you will find something no matter what your tastes.  The mimosa's are $12 each - enjoy!

OQImub6evGiBTwpQmoVUjA.review_text: Tuesday is Two-Dollar Taco Trivia Tuesday (the most alliterative night in town, apparently).  I go for the tacos.  And the trivia.  Delish.  And smart.  A few tips: Trivia starts at 8:30ish, but all the seats are gone by 8.  They stop serving tacos early and they run out even earlier, so order a table full as soon as you get there.  DON'T heckle the trivia master - he makes up all his own trivia questions and does all the hard work so that you can sit there with your friends feeling smart (or dumb) so don't HASSLE him.

S-eb2s_2Ec_1rcmvec-H2A.review_text: Cool bar, BUT there are a few douchey guys that  run rampant 'round this place. I guess that could be just about any bar in SF, so I'm not hating, just saying.. I will definitely be back but I will bring friends and ignore all weirdos lol

XPoZMOe_37r4Dl4YH274rg.review_text:
Looking for an upscale sports bar in North Beach that the girlfriends will like just as much as the guys?  This is it.  I was in there again last night and it was packed - with just as many women as guys.  I think this place actually 'has it all.'
  The owners gutted the old nasty Shannon's sports bar & completely remodeled it as a chic sports bar - it's definitely on my favorites list now - especially since my drink is waiting on me by the time I get to the end of the bar!  Got cool owners, a sweet bar and good beer on tap.  There are 4 monster flat screens around the place to provide your sports fix.  The menu isn't exactly expansive, but everything on it is tasty!
  And thank god there's finally something hanging on the walls.  I don't have an extra $14K laying around for the one painting I want so I'm actually contemplating becoming an art thief...

V47RQMHsdnJpCeIR0eBW1g.review_text: I'm going to go ahead and call/spell it Con. A pronoun. A gentleman's name. As used in the common phrase "Con is the best bartender I know in North Beach," and "I look forward to many nights at the bar being served by Con."  I never knew the previous incarnation of this bar but I don't care. On my FIRST visit, I was treated like and old friend or (beloved) family member. I am not sure I have ever had such a good time, my FIRST time... at a bar. I don't make it to North Beach as often as I wish, but next time? I'll be there. Look for me. I'll buy you a shot.

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: Good music and pretty good vibe. They have lots of alcohol and can even make a french martini!

WnzRueYdRWNSbkXB0_0i4Q.review_text: A true North Beach gem. A must goto bar / food spot.  Service = excellent. The bartender I've seen twice, forgot his name (has a beard) is awesome. Big fan.  Drinks = $5 for Jameson and Ginger Ale. Cheapish shot and beer specials. Beers on tap are great (love the various IPA's).  Food = The world's best (as claimed) bacon wrapped tater tots. Pretty good. Not the thickest cut of quality bacon, but wrapped in tots with a nice mayo/ketchup mix sauce is great.! ~$9 for a small plate, bit pricey but tasty.  The burgers are big and tasty, friends shared.  I got a taco salad for $9 in a cool pho bowl and the salad and beef (you can get chicken too) were great. The taco wrap on the outside was obviously from a wrapper, but hey, can't expect a bar to fry it like a Mexican restaurant.  Big fan. I'll be back for food and drink.

Xq7KR3Rbzz35bs01BGKj9w.review_text: Cool bar, not exactly a dive but not too trendy either. Decent selection of beer and a pretty good vibe. Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't too crowded, plenty of stool space. If you're doing a North Beach crawl, well worthy of a stopping point.

rX9yVuBgqDF-j8nxWIzonQ.review_text: This is one of the best bars in SF for good, blue collar, eating and drinking. The bartender (Dom I think?) is a great dude and pours you a beer quickly. They have several TVs and they even put on the Sacramento Kings for me (which no one else cared about). If you haven't been, swing by on a Monday for 50 cent wings. They have about 20 flavors and the guy cooking them takes real pride in his wings. Bars like this are becoming rare in SF so support them when you can.

Zn8tgekH0oCfyk4SUtygoA.review_text: Every place I visit frequently, I need to find "the spot" where I can be the not-so-regular, regular. This is my place, starting back when it was Woody Zips.  The food is always tasty although the menu has changed a bit over the years. The bar tenders really do a great job catering to both the true regulars, the not-so-regular regulars.    Enjoy, catch a game, and "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." (Oscar Wilde)

wkklbFK50TTkd1GJXXAntA.review_text: Meh chicken wings, meh bacon wrapped tator tots.  Food was average.

wYv2sUTQ1KTA07qBe7HpUA.review_text: I am revising this poor review (1) to a (3) reflecting management care and reaching out to me to correct the problem. I would've given a (4) if it weren't for an employee's extreme rudeness at the location. White male with long blond hair and tattoos. He was very disrespectful to our group the first time we ever went. After discussing with other employees this seems to be a common occurrence for this dude.

k8BqTw1CV7W7iamfKjCLww.review_text: Kickass! Martin (the bartender) remembered my boyfriend and after we hadn't been there since basketball season. He even remembered that we had just started dating then. Impressive!

dTdltcr2EC5oMZ1rs795PA.review_text: The fried food is pretty damn good.  as in the tots are really good.  The BLTA is also really good.  the dip is decent.  The sweet potato fries are pretty good too.  good spot to check out for lunch during non-sports hours, since nobody is really there.  The beer and drinks are standard here.  if you're not going for a meal, check out the bacon wrapped tater tots, also worth checking out - though every time i've had them, i was drunk.

iBetxak4rYFEY9VW26pQsQ.review_text: So I normally do not hang out in North Beach--too close in proximity to the Marina.  But it's playoff season and my roommate's dad is in town from NY and we all wanted to go watch the games somewhere.  Last weekend my roommate and I went to Mad Dog and that didn't work out so well--too many soccer fans.  Like any Yelper, I searched for a good, mellow sports bar to get a burger.  Woody Zips showed up and I thought I'd give it a try.  It was great.  The staff is beyond friendly and in a very genuine way.  The TV quality and placement is key and the food is basic and good.  The burger was particularly spicy, but good spicy.  And, like my roommate's dad said, "The fries got just the right amount of too much salt."  I had a good time, just wish the game had turned out differently.

JZwZxnYdCxb8Z-DWT6H3dA.review_text: This place is awesome!  Salvador was the bartender and he was incredibly friendly the food is delicious.   Take my advice,  ask the cook to "get crazy" with their Boardroom burger.   You won't be sorry.   Also,  have to heard of bacon wrapped tater tots? Because you should have.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: I have fond memories of the Boardroom. It was where I had my last round of drinks pre-sobriety (darn you medicine!). It was one of many places I went post-sobriety. It was where I was thoroughly entertained by witnessing a cute (girl) bartender hitting on my cute (male) colleague...while my other colleague and I pointed out all her moves. In another language, of course. We have some decency...well, not really. Bartender probably knew...but colleague didn't until we pointed it out!  Found myself stumbling back here the other day...and they have bacon-wrapped tater tots. That's right. Bacon makes everything better, and they have made the tater tot into something amazing. AMAZING. We were also tempted by the hot wings...which had the scent, but didn't taste as good as we'd like. It has a good crisp and flavor, but...it was JUST this side of dry. Boo.  Current bartenders here are very friendly and attentive. Is a very comfortable place to hang out!

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: my friend had a guest-bartending event at the boardroom last week - i thought it was a pretty cool bar that i would go to otherwise.  definitely one star for keith, the owner, who let us have the event there and trained us on how to bartend (a skill that did NOT come easily to me whatsoever and will not develop into a new career...).  apparently they have guest-bartending on thursdays pretty often.   they also serve food there - standard bar food, the mozzarella sticks and tater-tots were good though!  the boardroom definitely has a cool atmosphere, nothing special, just a fun local bar vibe.  if you are a sports fan, they have a bunch of tv's to watch sporting events too.

zpmViTr7g_1Ig8jPO0VNSQ.review_text: Had to update with an extra star for chill ambiance, Sunday late night happy hour and delicious sweet potato fries.  Is that better Keith? Where's the hot tub??????

ZtfYa68Qbr4rkhNMsmYhqw.review_text: Great North Beach neighborhood bar, with a surprising variety of good food, friendly bartenders, and a good selection of well made drinks.

l0PYkotRgNgz4ZqAjGFzPg.review_text: Compared to some of the other bars on that side of Columbus, The Boardroom isn't that bad. It's clean, has a couple of TVs, and decently priced drinks. The bathroom isn't the size of a closet, but the bar itself isn't that big. It seems to cater to the locals, where everyone knew each other but us.   No comment on the food, since I try hard to stay away from food served at a typical bar where the kitchen seems to be invisible.

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: Boardroom, I think I have a crush on you. Below is a list of reasons why:  1. This cozy local bar is conveniently down the street from my apartment. 2. Tuesday Trivia night!     -Oh yeah teams, it's on!  3. Bingo Wednesdays?!  4. Taco Tuesdays     -$2 tacos. The fish tacos rule! 5. 1 shot of Jager & an Olympia=$6.     -Right on specials!  6. Drinks & a handful of eats (served until 10-11ish)! 7. Friendly staff 8. Small, clean, and not too loud 9. TV 10. Cash & Credit  (with $20 minimum)  Ooooh dear Boardroom, I will definitely never get "board" of you! ;)

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: Bacon. Wrapped. Tots.   It looks like a total hole from the outside, but when you walk in, it's the exact opposite. Clean, sorta dive-y, snacks, beers, tv...I'm into it. Bacotots were a lot spendier than I thought they'd be. For a dollar more than the boat of regular tots, you got like 9 bacon wrapped tots. Don't get me wrong, those bacotots were perfectly crisp and tasty, but I'm still trying to grasp why there's such a difference in quantity. Labor intensive? Meh.

dgm6oxrldL81fJ0jlMJ3Qg.review_text: Was having a pretty good time here with a group of friends until I was getting ready to leave. I was waiting on my boyfriend when suddenly I felt something hit my chest. The bartender had thrown a plastic cup at me from behind the bar. When I asked him why, he stated "You looked like you weren't having fun." Yes, because hitting me with a projectile object is going to help me have an awesome time. Screw you. Who behaves like that and works in customer service?

98kge3NovzBHx61kPyIMSg.review_text: Happened to stumble upon the Boardroom one day while we were scouting drink specials in North Beach before a friend's band played at Grant & Green.   BEST. STUMBLE. EVER.  Walked in enticed by the tecate + jagermeister special. You can't go wrong with that combo for $6. It was a pretty quiet night, so we chatted up the bartender about the confusion of which football team the bar roots for, and their beers on tap. I must have looked hungry because the next thing I know, he plops a menu down right in front of me.   Perused it a bit, hoping for something small to tide us over before dinner time. And saw the most enticing words I have ever seen on a bar menu "Bacon wrapped tots." Bacon wrapped tots?!?!?! I was intrigued. So we ordered them up assuming the worst, but hoping for something at least worth digesting.  A few minutes later, we were presented with a plate filled with tiny brown treasures that smelled like an angel's fart (kinda salty and fills the room.... but in a good way). The bartender knew we were about to lose our bacon-wrapped-tot-virginity, so he gave us the run down. The ranch is infused with bacon au jus (!!!!!) and mixed with a bit of the house hot sauce is the perfect little bite.   Oh dear God. My mouth was dancing. That bite was euphoric. The tot was perfectly cooked- tender and fluffy in the center with a nice tot-ty texture. The bacon, which I completely expected to be a chewy mess that would destroy the tot, was quite the opposite. The bacon was crispy and light and perfectly salty without being toooo salty. The ranch complemented the tot so beautifully as if they were created only to accompany each other in life. And the house hot sauce..... just enough heat to wake up your tastebuds so that they can experience this tot magic exactly as the heavens imagined.   Aside from this experience, everything else about this place is fantastic. The locals are really friendly and the bartenders are freakin hysterical. There are always sports on the two TVs and the rest of the food is pretty good too. They have a great brunch menu, if you're into that kind of thing too. I hear the bloody mary is yummy.  Thanks Boardroom, for ruining tots everywhere else.

4eGaEAnGqrxO-lmRFgtU3g.review_text: Fun, fun, fun.  The folks at Woody Zips are super-cool and so are the patrons.  The guys are laid back and allow people to "guest bartend" on Wednesdays.  I did it along with a friend to raise money for a charity -- it was a huge success financially (can't say as much for my friend's livers).  This is a great place to go, especially if Northstar gets too dirty or crowded, just crawl across the intersection and belly up to the bar.  Also major bonus points for their bathroom: the bathroom is cleaner and infinitely roomier than many of the bathrooms in North Beach.  They also have tons of beers on draft and good drink specials.  Oh, almost forgot, they also have a kitchen, so they can fill your belly with good grub too.

Tf9rV21VCEikyjB14qM5VA.review_text: Really nice and helpful bartender. Menu looks good. I like this place.

iwRBlpUvLYTrAG-a2v5iTg.review_text: The bartender here begs for tips when you order drinks.  Pathetic service. Patrons throwing up outside on the front steps, poor service.  Sad excuse for a bar.   Steer clear of this place.
